Hawa (seated first from the right in the photo) is an important leader of farming activities during the rainy season in the village of Fabougou. She plans to use her loan to plow her field, to buy seeds and fertilizers, and then to hire some young people for weeding.

She sells her crops for cash at the end of the rainy season and this allows her to repay her loan and have enough revenues to take care of her children and, to some extent, of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 21-year-old single lady who has worked in selling clothes since a year ago. Her business is going just fine but she needs an external financial push to support it and diversify its products to respond better to customers' needs.

Hanan is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to start new perfumes and accessories selling sectors. These additional sectors will attract her customers' attention and increase her income. 

At the beginning she had problems while starting her business because she wasn't capable of finding a shop at the main road to attract foreign customers, but since a year ago her number of customers has been increasing because of her customer service and special reputation in her region.

She hopes to open in the future separate perfumes and accessories specialized shops and develop her business more and more in her region and the neighboring ones.

loans.use: to start new perfumes and accessories selling sectors.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Analyn is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Analyn has a ready-to-wear business,buying and selling clothing in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy pants, T-shirts, slippers, bags, etc. to sell.

Analyn has been in this business for 10 years. Analyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy pants, T-shirts, slippers, bags, etc.  to sell

loans.name: Bareen

texts.en:
Bareen, age 26, is a married woman and a mother of three. She has been running a business of clothing sales for some years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. She enjoys good repute in her town due to her good quality fabrics and excellent dealing with her customers. 

Currently she accessed a loan of Rs. 20,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members such as her father. 

Rehema has had a tailoring business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 70,0000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDTSACCO to buy more rolls of dress making material. 

Rehema generates additional income through poultry farming. She sells wholesale seven days a week. The major challenges to her business are seasonality and defaulters. Rehema aspires to own a tailoring school. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. 

Rehema's monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of dress making material.

loans.name: Benkaditon 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Benkaditon 1 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 36ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Massalawere dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Menata (2ème femme arrêté de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Massalawere.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter les petits équipements , s’acheter des  semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women who make up the Benkaditon 1 group are all married within traditional families. On average, they are 36 years old and have five children each. They all live in the village of Massalawere, in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know one another through their seasonal farm work and also through neighborhood, marriage and family ties within the village. They grow groundnuts, millet and rice.

They have joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to buy small tools and farm inputs, and they are on their second farming loan.

Menata (standing second from the left in the photo) is an important leader of farming activities during the rainy season in the village of Massalawere. She plans to use her loan to buy small tools, seeds and fertilizers, and then to hire some young people to weed her field. 

She sells her crops for cash at the end of the rainy season and this allows her to repay her loan and have enough revenues to take care of her children and, to some extent, of her family.

loans.use: to buy small tools, seeds and farm inputs.

loans.name: Taleb

texts.en:
Taleb is 49 years old and is from Jenin. He is married and has three children, one of whom attends primary school. Taleb has owned a grocery store since 2008 and has one employee who helps him.

Taleb asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy goods and drinks for his grocery store. He hopes that this loan will help him increase the goods displayed and thus improve his sales and income, which will help him provide his children with the best education.

loans.use: to buy goods and drinks for his grocery store

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 31-year-old married woman. One year ago, she started her own general store in her area to support her family very well. She offers various types of grocery items to her customers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She has become famous by providing good quality products and makes enough money to lead a decent life. As she wants to expand her business, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, sugar and beverages in large quantities. She is in her fourth loan cycle with good loan history. With this new loan she would be able to generate more revenue that will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, sugar and beverages in large quantities.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen, age 26, deals in the business of stitching clothes. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good repayment history. She wishes to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 29-year-old married man from Lebanon who lives with his wife and only child. He has owned a car repair shop since 2011. 

Imad's job consists of repairing cars, both inside and outside. He works very hard to support his family and recently, he hired a part-time employee to help him complete the work. 

With Imad's requested youth loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, he will increase his shop’s inventory of mechanical tools and supplies such as oils, screw-drivers, hummers etc.

In the future, Imad plans to open a new branch of his shop, where he will sell spare car parts.

loans.use: increase his shop’s inventory of mechanical tools and supplies.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica  is 38 years old, married and the mother of three children. She lives in Zamboanga del Sur. She owns and operates a fishing boat, catching fish and crabs to sell in the market in town. She has been doing this for 10 years to earn a living. She borrowed a loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fishing materials. She hopes to have another fishing boat in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en: Bashiran is a 40-year-old married woman actively running a 'Tandoor' in her house for many years. A tandoor (clay oven) is used for cooking chapattis and naan, specially in Pakistan. She cooks chapattis and naan with flour, salt and oil then sells them to her neighbors. She also takes orders from nearby hotels and makes enough money for a decent life. She is a loving mother of five children and is responsible for their food, health and education and trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 15,000 PKR to purchase more sacks of flour with packs of salt and oil. She hopes to increase her net income and wishes to provide good and quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of flour with packs of salt and oil.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 23-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a flower-making business for the past five years. Shumaila offers various colorful flowers for decorating homes and events such as birthdays and parties etc. 

Shumaila sells the flowers to the people in her community and also supplies in the local market. She has good communication skills and has a good client list. Shumaila is in her fourth loan cycle and has a good loan history. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistani Rupees (PKR) to buy raw material such as fabric, glace and tissue paper, as well as packs of paint in various colors. 

In this way, Shumaila will be able to meet the increasing demands of her customers consistently. She wishes to spend part of the revenue to deal with the expenses of her family and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as fabric, glace and tissue paper, as well as packs of paint in various colors.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 28-year-old hard-working married woman. She has been in the business of stitching clothes for the past three years. She is expert in designing clothes according to the demands of her customers, and she makes a good amount of money to contribute to the family income. Now she is also receiving some orders from a nearby boutique, but due to a lack of funds she is unable to complete the orders on time. For this reason, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy more spools of threads in various colors, along with some packs of laces, ribbons, zippers and buttons. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has a good loan history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy threads, laces, ribbons, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Benkaditon 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Benkaditon 3 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 45ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Massalawere dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont adhéré à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Faty (femme assise au milieu parmi les assises dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Massalawere.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de petits équipements, des  semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 women from the group called Benkaditon 3 are all married in traditional families. They have an average age of 45 and on average five children. They all live in the village of Massalawere in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali.) They met through their rainy season agricultural activities and ties of neighborhood,  marriage and kinship in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice. In order to buy small equipment and to stock up on farm inputs, the members of the group joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second cycle seasonal loan. 

Madame  Faty (the woman sitting in the photo in the middle of the row of seated women) works hard at her rainy season agricultural activities in the village of Massalawere.  She intends to use her loan to buy small equipment, seeds and fertilizer and also to pay young people to weed her field.  The sale of her agricultural produce takes place for cash at the end of the rainy season to repay her loan and in order to have income to cover children's expenses and a part of the family's household expenses.

loans.use: to buy small equipment, seeds, and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en:
Sumera is a 31-year-old married woman who works from her home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for twelve years and is proud to be contributing to her household income. 

Sumera's husband has a business selling ‘Naan’ but is unable to run the household alone. Therefore, Sumera felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working on her own. 

Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele but now she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. So, Sumera requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistani Rupees (PKR) to purchase reels of threads, packs of needles, buttons and zippers. 

With this loan, Sumera will be able to stitch up more dresses for her customers. Sumera hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase reels of threads, packs of needles, buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Mumbo

texts.en:
Mumbo is a married woman with six children. Five of the children attend school while one is still young. Mumbo lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 11 years, she has operated a food stall, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business, and she dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan of 30,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour and beans

loans.name: Bako

texts.en: Bako is 50 years old, married, and has two children. Being a responsible father, Bako works hard every day to generate income so that he can cover his daily costs. He is dedicated to farming, growing potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers on his own land. In order to contribute to improving his family's living standards, he has been working hard from early morning till late evening for 27 years. Bako would like to develop his business, which is why he is applying for a loan in the amount of 6,500 TJS (Tajiki somoni) to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds to prepare for the new planting season.

loans.name: Benkaditon 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes de Benkaditon 4 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Massalawere dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Djeneba (femme assise au bout à gauche  dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Massalawere.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de petits équipements, s’acheter des  semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven women from the group called Benkaditon 4 are all married in traditional families. They have an average age of 35 and on average four children. They all live in the village of Massalawere in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali.) They met through their rainy season agricultural activities and ties of neighborhood, marriage and kinship in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice. In order to buy small equipment and to stock up on farm inputs, the members of the group joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second seasonal loan.

Madame Djeneba  (the woman sitting at the end on the left in the photo) works hard at her rainy season agricultural activities in the village of Massalawere. She intends to use her loan to buy small equipment, seeds and fertilizer and also to pay young people to weed her field. The sale of her agricultural produce takes place for cash at the end of the rainy season to repay her loan and in order to have income to cover children's expenses and a part of the family's household expenses.

loans.use: to buy small equipment, seeds, and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Anjie

texts.en:
Anjie is a married man and a father of three. He lives in the village of Zamboanga del Sur. 

To earn a living, Anjie works, fishing and selling his catch in the market. His wife is a food vendor. 

Anjie borrowed from GDMPC micro credit to buy fishing nets to be used for fishing. He hopes to earn more income and be able to save a portion of it for the bright future of the family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Komboza

texts.en: Komboza operates a fish-selling business, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. He faces major challenges because of high transportation costs and stiff competition. With the KES 40,000 loan, he wants to buy bundles of fish for resale. He dreams of expanding his business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen, 24, is married woman. She is an enthusiastic lady who has been making wooden baskets at home for many years. She makes a wide range of beautiful wooden baskets in different colors and designs and sells them in the local market. She has become popular in her community for providing good quality baskets, and she earns enough for a decent life. In order to expand her business, she has to carry out new investments, so she applied for a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy bundles of different types of wood and some colorful ribbons, to offer a variety of baskets to her customers. She is in her second loan cycle and hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy bundles of different types of wood and some colorful ribbons to make baskets.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is a 47-year-old married woman and the mother of seven children. Three years ago, she started her own business selling clothes to support her large family. She has a wide variety of ladies’ and gents’ clothes, which she buys from the Faisalabad market and sells in her locality at reasonable prices. She has gradually improved her business and has now applied for a loan of PKR 25,000. She will use this loan to buy a variety of ladies’ and gents’ clothes in different colors and designs to increase her sales. She is in her second loan cycle, with a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to buy a variety of ladies' and gents' clothes in different colors and designs for resale.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en: At the age of 30, Saira is an energetic married lady. She is a hardworking mother of three children who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing this for the past three years. She is familiar with the techniques of stitching that are fashionable. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She manages her household expenses with her business income. To help continue operating her business, she applied for a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy a stock of thread in various colors and packets of zippers, buttons and laces, in order to meet increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in various colors and packs of zippers, buttons and laces for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en: Silvia lives in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya, situated on the slopes of Mt. Kenya. She has three children who are of school-going age. She is a mixed farmer. She has applied for a loan of KES 50,000 to build a zero grazing pen. This will help in her dairy farming. She will obtain more milk, and her income will increase. This will help her give better education to her children. The challenge that she is facing is of unreliable markets for her milk production. In the future, she aims at producing over 100 liters of milk per day. Silvia says that Juhudi Kilimo supports agricultural practices that favor farmers.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing pen.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a good sewer. She is a 64-year-old woman who is married with children. Her husband is a kind man who tries to help her with all deals. 

Olga tries to provide her family with a better quality of life. That is why, eight years ago, she began own business, sewing national women's dresses. She has additional business with aviculture. She breeds duck and turkey. 

Olga must buy air ticket for her daughter who does not have a job in Tajikistan. Her daughter plans to go to Russia and work there. Olga is asking for a loan of 1,050 United States Dollars (USD) to buy an air ticket. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy an air ticket for her daughter, who wants to go to Russia.

loans.name: Esonboy

texts.en: Esonboy is 61 years old. He lives in a place which has wonderful nature, with his wife and five children. Their main source of income is from their farm. They own a plot of land where they grow potatoes and crops. They sell their harvest at the local markets, from which they derive a small monthly income. For some years he has tried to organize a business selling something at retail, but he does not have the money and experience to organize a business and improve their poor living conditions. He asked his wife for advice and decided to develop his farming business, where he has great experience and skills. As he lives far from town, in a village, he has a good opportunity to develop his farming business. With his loan, he will start new sowing, for which he plans to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. He hopes that this loan will lead to a good harvest and the development of his  business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers to develop his farming business.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka operates a business selling cereal. She sells from her home to her neighbours and passersby. 

The major challenge to Mwaka's business is seasonality. Her dream is to establish a wholesale cereals business in the near future. 

With the loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES), Mwaka wants to purchase stock of wheat, maize, sugar and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She appreciates the help.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat, maize, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en: Fouzia, 36, is a married woman. She works hard to provide better a life style to her five children through her business. She has been working from home as a tailor for three years to contribute in her family’s income. She is considered an expert tailor in her community and gets lots of appreciation from her customers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. Her business enables her to meet the day-to-day expenses. To help her continue her operations, she applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy more spools of thread and some packets of ribbons, buttons, laces and zippers in various colors. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand from her customers on a consistent basis. She wants to spend the part of the revenues to cover the expenses of her family and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread and some packets of ribbons, buttons, laces and zippers in various colors for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en: Humaira, 25, is a married woman; she conducts a business sewing clothes to help her husband financially, as her husband is employed at a low salary. To meet the expenses of the family members, she works hard and makes enough to contribute to the family income. People of her community prefer her for sewing fine, stylish, dresses. She has built a list of regular customers; they are her neighbors and members of the local community. To help her continue operating her business, she applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy a stock of thread in various colors and packets of zippers, elastic and needles to meet increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in various colors and packets of zippers, elastic and needles for her sewing business.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es: Cindy tiene 26 años,  es soltera y  vive en la casa de sus padres junto a sus dos hermanos. Cindy se dedica a  brindar servicio de atención a pacientes con alguna dolencia y que requieren de atención médica inmediata o rutinaria. Recientemente ha iniciado esta nueva faceta para desarrollar su profesión de enfermera ya que considera que la vida y la salud de las personas es lo primordial para seguir adelante. Realiza todo tipo de análisis o exámenes médicos siempre con mucha responsabilidad, respeto y confidencialidad hacia el paciente. Lleva en esta labor cerca de 2 años y hasta momento le va muy bien. Espera seguir trabajando como lo ha hecho hasta ahora y poco a poco implementar su local de atención con la adquisición de nuevos implementos de laboratorio para empezar a realizar análisis diversos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3800, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará artículos de asepsia como guantes quirúrgicos, alcohol, algodón, jeringas y algunas pastillas para malestares leves.
texts.en:
Cindy is 26 years old, single, and lives in her parents house together with her 2 brothers. Cindy attends to patients with some ailments that require immediate or routine medical attention. She has recently initiated this new service, enhancing her professional development in nursing, because she believes that people's lives and health are of primary importance for getting ahead. She does all types of analysis and medical exams, always with much responsibility, respect, and confidentiality for the patient.

Cindy has been doing this for almost 2 years and up to the present, it has gone very well. She hopes to continue working as she has so far, little by little drawing attention to her business with the acquisition of new laboratory implements in order to begin carrying out diverse analyses. 

On this occasion, she is requesting 3,800 sols. Cindy is grateful and content with the knowledge that she can continue counting on the financial help she needs to advance her clinic's progress. With the money solicited, she will purchase articles for asepsis, such as surgical gloves, alcohol, cotton, syringes, plus some pills for more serious illnesses.

loans.use: buy articles for asepsis such as alcohol, cotton, and some pills for her patients.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes tienes 32 años, es madre soltera y vive en su casa propia junto sus 3 hijos. Mercedes se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, ella se encarga con suma paciencia de elaborar las prendas que sus clientes le solicitan. Se dedica a esta labor cerca de 2 años, siempre ha trabajado sola. Está muy tranquila porque sabe que su trabajo le permite generar sus propios ingresos económicos con los que brinda todas las comodidades que sus hijos necesitan. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede plasmar en un prenda el diseño en el que se inspira, se siente útil siempre; espera pronto construir un taller de costura mucho más grande y destinar un espacio únicamente destinado a la venta de sus creaciones. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable. Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales de costura como telas, hilos, elásticos, encajes y lycra.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 32 years old and is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her three children. 

Mercedes earns her living making clothing for women, men and children. She tasks herself with making the clothes her clients order with the utmost patience. She has been doing this work for about two years, and has always worked alone. 

She is very peaceful because she knows her work allows her to earn her own income which provides every comfort her children need. What she likes about her work is that she can capture in a garment a design that inspires her, and she always feels useful. 

Soon, she hopes to build a much larger sewing workshop and set aside a space dedicated only to the sale of her creations. For this opportunity, she is asking for S/. 2000 (2000 Nuevo Soles). 

She is very excited to know that there are people providing economic support to continue developing her work, so she promises to be a punctual and responsible partner. With the amount she is asking for, she will buy sewing materials such as fabrics, threads, elastics, lace and lycra.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials, such as fabrics, threads, and elastics, among others, for her business.

loans.name: Djekassigui 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Djekassigui 3 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 29 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Ouolobougouni. dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame   Bintou  (deuxième  femme debout au bout à droite  dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Ouolobougouni.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des  semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of "Djekassigui 3" are all married in traditional families, and they average 29 years of age and two children each, all living in the village of Ouolobougouni, in Région de Ségou (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through their rainy season farm work and through ties of community, marriage, and kinship in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice.

With the goal of purchasing tools and supplying themselves with farm inputs, the group members learned about the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second farm loan cycle.

Ms. Bintou (second woman standing from the right in the photo) is a great leader of rainy season farm work in the village of Ouolobougouni. She intends to use her loan to plow her field, purchase some seeds and manure, and then pay young people to weed the field. 

At the end of the rainy season, the produce is sold in cash to pay back the loan in order to have the income to care for the children and some for the family.

loans.use: to purchase tools, seeds, and farm inputs

loans.name: Odalis

texts.es: Odalis tiene 33 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Odalis se dedica a la compra y venta de vehículos, su negocio está ubicado en su casa en una esquina muy concurrida. Al momento de realizar la transacción de los vehículos siempre está muy al pendiente de brindar todos los documentos en regla y que los vehículos estén en óptimas condiciones. Lleva realizando este negocio por 6 años y lo hace a lado de su esposo quien se encarga de refaccionar los vehículos que ponen luego a la venta. Le gusta lo que hace ya que le permite tener buenos ingresos, siempre está con el ánimo elevado con una sonrisa para sus clientes y espera poder seguir trabajando y más adelante poner una tienda de venta de vehículos nuevos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará 1 vehículo y sus respectivas piezas para refaccionarlo y ponerlo a la venta y continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Odalis is 33 years old, is married and lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. 

Odalis makes her living buying and selling vehicles. Her business is located in her house, at a very busy corner. At the time of transaction for the vehicles, she is always very attentive that vehicles are in good condition, and to provide all documents in order. 

She has been doing this business for six years, and she does it with her husband, who is in change of repairing vehicles which are later put up for sale. She likes what she does, as it allows her to earn a good income. She always has high spirits and a smile for her customers, and she hopes to be able to continue working and later set up a store selling new vehicles. 

In this loan, she is asking for 2000 new soles. She is very happy to know she will have financial support, as she will feel more secure in advancing with her business. On the other hand, she promises to comply in a timely fashion with her payments. With the amount requested, she will buy one vehicle and its respective parts to repair it and put it up for sale and continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy one vehicle and its parts, to fix it and sell it in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Los Palomos Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario los Palomos, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Ana Maria de 49 años de edad,soltera y se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno,y como actividad secundaria se dedica a la venta de leche, se ha dedicado ha esta actividad desde hace varios años, es por eso que esta solicitando este credito ya que para produceir mas leche ella nececita invertir mas en la compra de terneras, ya que gracias ha la calidad de leche que vende sus clientes han aumentado y con la cantidad que producen su terneras que tiene actualmente no alcanza cubri la demanda de sus clientes, el sueño de ella y si Dios lo permite es tener mas animales (terneras) que produscan mas leche y asi superarse un poco mas en su negocio y tener mas oportunidades en su vida en el futuro.
texts.en:
The Solidario los Palomos group is led by Ana Maria, who is 49 years old and single. She earns her living raising cattle and, as a secondary activity, she sells milk. 

She has been doing this work for many years. She is asking for a loan because in order to produce more milk, she needs to invest more in the purchase of calves. Thanks to the quality of the milk she sells, her customers have grown, and with the amount her heifers produce, she isn't able to cover her customers' demand. 

Her dream, God allowing, is to have more animals (calves) that produce more milk and in this way succeed a little more in her business and have more opportunities in her life in the future.

loans.use: to buy cattle (calves).

loans.name: Chaska Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de pobladores en la comunidad de Ninamarca formaron el banco comunal “Chaska” en la provincia de Paucartambo hace varios años atrás. En esta comunidad no hay industrias, empresas, bancos pero hay grandes terrenos de cultivos donde la gente siembra papa, maiz y cria sus animales entonces la mayoría de los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.    

Hilaria tiene 28 años de edad y nació en el poblado de Accha pero vive en el comunidad de Ninamarca, ella es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos, ella es una persona responsable y amable que sale adelante pues su actividad económica principal es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y también se dedica a la agricultura entonces tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, cebada, trigo y habas, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales menores como cuyes y gallinas para incrementar su capital de negocio. (Hilaria en la fotografía está levantando la mano). 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (La fotografía de la socia que aparece adjunta en la foto principal pidió permiso a la junta directiva del banco comunal para no estar presente en la reunión). 
(El poblado de Ninamarca está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Several years ago a group of settlers in the Ninamarca community formed the “Chaska” communal bank in the Paucartambo province.  In this community there is no industry or commerce, and there are no banks.  However, there are large pieces of agricultural land where the people grow potatoes and corn and raise their animals.  Most of the people there work in agriculture and with livestock.

Hilaria, age 28, was born in the village of Accha, but she lives in the Ninamarca community.  She is married, and they have three children.  She is a responsible and kind person who gets ahead.  Her main business activity is raising small animals like guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs.  She also works in agriculture.  She has various pieces of land where she grows potatoes, barley, wheat, and beans.

She now needs a loan to buy more small animals like guinea pigs and chickens in order to increase her business capital.  (Hilaria is raising her hand in the photograph).

The members are grateful for the opportunity provided, and they pledge to make their different payments on time.  (The member in the inset photograph asked permission from the board of directors of the communal bank to not be present at the meeting).

(The town of Ninamarca is in the Paucartambo province, Cusco department, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy more small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Karla

texts.es: Karla tiene 41 años, es madre soltera y vive en su local alquilado junto a su pequeña hija. Karla se dedica a la venta de calzados variados. El comercial donde realiza su actividad está ubicado en una zona céntrica. Entre los artículos que ofrece a sus clientes tiene sandalias, zapatillas, zapatos nuevos o usados, tanto de varones como mujeres. Empezó con su actividad hace 4 años y trabaja sola. Considera a su negocio  bastante rentable por la demanda que tienen sus productos y las buenas ganancias económicas que recibe. Le gusta su trabajo porque logra siempre vender toda su mercadería en corto tiempo, le está yendo muy bien, por fortuna tiene muchos clientes fieles. Espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable. Con el monto solicitado comprará más mercadería consistente en calzados como zapatos y zapatillas de diversa marcas y modelos de damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
Karla is a 41 year old single mother, and lives in a rented space together with her little daughter. Karla earns her living selling various types of footwear. The store where she does her work is located in a central area. 

Among the items she offers her clients, she has sandals, slippers, new and used shoes for both men and women. She started this business four years ago and works alone. She considers her business quite profitable because of the demand for her products and the good income she receives. She likes her work because she is always successful in selling all of her merchandise in little time. Her business is doing very well, and she fortunately has many loyal customers.

She is asking for a loan of 1500 nuevo soles. She is very excited to know that there are people providing economic support to continue developing her business, so she promises to be a timely and responsible partner. With the amount she is asking for, she will buy more merchandise consisting of footwear, such as shoes and slippers of various brands, with styles for women, men and children.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and slippers to sell in her footwear business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products like candy, notebooks, and pencils, etc.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan  tiene 66 años de edad, es casado y vive con tres hijos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de insumos y semillas para asistir una plantación de hortalizas, el se dedica a esta actividad agrícola desde hace ya varios años. El quiere aumentar un poco las ventas. El se ha dedicado con su familia al cultivo de hortalizas. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Juan is 66 years old and is married with three children. He would like this loan to buy supplies and seeds so that he can plant vegetables. He has made a living with this agricultural activity for many years. He wishes to increase his sales. His work growing vegetables is carried out with his family. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has not had loans previously in state banks but FUDECOSUR has offered him this loan with great ease and with a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant vegetables.

loans.name: Amon

texts.en:
Amon, a 26-year-old married father of two children, lives in Kasese, Uganda, where he has operated a secretarial business for two years. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he also practices farming to earn additional income in order to improve his family's welfare, pay school fees for his children and buy more land.

Amon is now requesting a loan to buy a photocopier. He hopes to expand his business, but strong competition and customers not paying on time are his major challenges.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah, a 46-year-old married woman, has worked in her convenience store since 2005 to help her retired husband in making their living and covering their increasing family expenses. She also sells home products.

Sabah is requesting her fourth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for her daughter's wedding preparations and needs. She will also use part of the loan to invest in her business through the purchase of special summer and Holy Ramadan dates and beverages.

Sabah hopes to keep on diversifying her products and improving upon their quality.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's wedding preparations and purchase more products for her store.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es: La Sra. Nila de 51 años de edad y madre de 3 hijos, la Sra. Nila  tiene una pequeña  librería (alquilado)  ya hace unos  3  años. La Sra. Nila  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos para su librería (libros, útiles escolares, etc) y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Nila  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Nila es la primera  de la mano derecha  está sentada casaca ploma, se despide con un fuerte abrazo a Kiva y por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Nila is 51 years old and the mother of three children. She has had a small bookstore (rented) for three years. 

Nila has come to have loyal customers, which has generated profits to cover the costs of her household. In the future, she would like to have her own location where she can sell her products and earn a better income. 

With the loan provided, she will invest in buying more products for her bookstore (books, schools supplies, etc.) and thus continue satisfying the needs of her customers and get ahead. Nila and all the members of her group are grateful to Kiva for the loan and for the confidence it has brought them. 

Nila is the first woman on the right, sitting with the jacket. She says goodbye with a big hug to Kiva for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy books and school supplies.

loans.name: Dúo Amor Y Fé Group

texts.es:
DUO AMOR Y FÉ  
DUO CONFORMADO POR JOSE GERONIMO DE 27 AÑOS DE EDAD ES ORIGINARIO DEL AREA DE SAN MARTIN JILOTEPEQUE, JOSE SE DEDICA A LA ACRIANZA DE CERDOS Y POLLOS Y COMO TRABAJO SECUNDARIO MANEJA UN MOTOTAXI, EL LUCHA A DIARIO POR VIVIR DE UNA MANERA DIGNA YA QUE POR MEDIO DE LOS CREDITO EL HA PODIDO TENER LA OPORTUNIDAD DE COMPRAR MAS ANIMALES, SOLICITAN EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE MAS GALLINAS Y CERDOS,Y PARA LA COMPRA DE ALIMENTOS PARA LOS MISMOS AGRADECE A FAPE Y KIVA EL APOYO BRINDADO PARA SACAR SU NEGOCIO ADELANTE.
texts.en: One member of the "Amor y Fé" (Love and Faith) duo is 27 year old José Geronimo from the area of San Martín Jilotepeque. José makes a living raising pigs and chickens and also works driving a moto-taxi. He fights every day to live in a dignified way because through his loans he has been able to buy more animals and is requesting the loan to buy more chickens and pigs, as well as to purchase the food needed for these animals. He is thankful to FAPE and Kiva for the support provided so that he can get ahead with his business.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and food to feed the animals.

loans.name: Ng'anzuki

texts.en:
Nganzuki has been operating a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business, and she dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

Here she comes to you again, requesting a loan of KES 20,000. She wants to purchase stock of wheat, maize, beans and rice, for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat, maize, beans and rice, for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron equipment so that he can make  doors and windows to increase his profit.

loans.name: Djekassigui 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Djekassigui 1 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Ouolobougouni. dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Alimata M. (dernière femme debout au bout à droite  dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Ouolobougouni.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des  semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of "Djekassigui 1" are all married in traditional families, and they average 39 years of age and three children each, all living in the village of Ouolobougouni, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through their rainy season farm work and through ties of community, marriage, and kinship in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice.

With the goal of purchasing tools and supplying themselves with farm inputs, the group members learned about the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second farm loan cycle.

Ms. Alimata M. (last woman standing from the right, at the end in the photo) is a great leader of rainy season farm work in the village of Ouolobougouni. She intends to use her loan to plow her field, purchase some seeds and manure, and then pay young people to weed the field. 

At the end of the rainy season, the produce is sold in cash to pay back the loan in order to have the income to care for the children and some for the family.

loans.use: to purchase tools, seeds, and farm inputs

loans.name: Djekassigui 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Djekassigui 2 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Ouolobougouni. dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Baissa (deuxième  femme debout au bout à droite  dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Ouolobougouni.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des  semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of "Djekassigui 2" are all married in traditional families, and they average 36 years of age and three children each, all living in the village of Ouolobougouni, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through their rainy season farm work and through ties of community, marriage, and kinship in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice.

With the goal of purchasing tools and supplying themselves with farm inputs, the group members learned about the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second farm loan cycle.

Ms. Baissa (second woman standing from the right in the photo) is a great leader of rainy season farm work in the village of Ouolobougouni. She intends to use her loan to plow her field, purchase some seeds and manure, and then pay young people to weed the field. 

At the end of the rainy season, the produce is sold in cash to pay back the loan in order to have the income to care for the children and some for the family.

loans.use: to purchase tools, seeds, and farm inputs.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 33-year-old, married man who has eight children. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. For three years, he has been selling produce, and engaging in transportation and rental housing businesses alongside the produce business, for side income. Hardworking as he is, he has been able to provide for the basic needs of his family and to furnish his rentals so as to add value. He has hopes of educating his children and getting a bigger store for his produce. However, seasonal changes are a challenge for his business. Samuel is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy produce to sell, such as maize and beans.

loans.use: to buy produce to sell, such as maize and beans

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past ten years, selling household products such as wheat flour, maize (corn) flour, and sugar. Her biggest challenge is stiff competition from other retail operators.

With this loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize (corn) flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mkambe

texts.en:
Mkambe is a married woman. She has seven kids who attend school. Her husband is a soldier and together they own a house that does not have electricity or piped water. 

She has operated a business, selling mats, for the past 7 months. Her potential clients are mostly her fellow villagers. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop of selling mats in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase a stock of mats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support in order to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase mats for resale.

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en:
Rohat is a seamstress with great experience.  She is 39 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is a kind man who tries to help her with all deals. They have three children and must comfort them with all modern conveniences. The fast development of the modern world makes her children more progressive. She tries to provide them with a better quality of life. That’s why, 15 years ago, she began her own business, sewing national women's dresses. Thanks to her good service, she has managed to gain many customers. Since she’s had her business, her family’s quality of life has been improving.

Rohat wants to repair her house, which is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 somoni, which she will use to buy cement, wood and other materials for house repairs. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cement, wood and other materials, for repairing her house

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is 56 years old and is from Gaza. He is married and has one child who attends school.

He has owned a shop for electronics repair since 2009. He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy and install shelves to display goods as well as to buy more maintenance materials for his electronic repair shop. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income.

loans.use: to buy and install shelves to display goods as well as to buy more maintenance materials for his electronic repair shop

loans.name: Hatem

texts.en:
Hatem is 48 years old, from Nablus. He is married and has three children, who attend school.

He has worked lifting building materials in construction, using a crane and a winch, since 2009. He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a crane that works on diesel instead of electrical power, like the one he owns.

Through this loan, he will be able to increase his work and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a crane that works on diesel, instead of electrical power (such as the one he owns).

loans.name: Idah

texts.en:
Idah lives in the Nkubu area of eastern Kenya, a very productive area situated along the slopes of Mt. Kenya.  She has four children, one of whom is still in school.  

She has been a farmer for thirty years; her main sources of income are tea leaves, bananas, coffee, maize and fish.

Idah wants to add to her income base by venturing into dairy farming, so she has requested a loan of KES. 20,000 to purchase dairy goats. This will increase her income base and will enable her to give her child a quality education.  It will also improve the family's standard of living.

The challenge she faces is poor climatic conditions. In five years, she wants to have reared a high-producing dairy cow.

Idah says that Juhudi Kilimo delivers on time.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy lives in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya. She has seven children. She has practiced farming for 29 years. Her source of income is milk, tea leaves, bananas and maize.
 
She wants to venture into poultry farming for egg production. Thus she has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES 60,000 to buy poultry. This loan will increase her income base and therefore provide her with a better standard of living. The challenges she faces are pests and disease control. In the future, she aspires to establish a biogas plant.

Joy says that investing in Juhudi Kilimo, clients are able to get more profits.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Kasiko

texts.en:
Kasiko is a married man, and he has six kids, all of them attending school. His wife is a farmer, and together they own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. He has operated a meat goat-selling business for the past two years. His potential customers are mostly butchers. He dreams of establishing his own butcher shop, in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, he wants to purchase six goats for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access financial support, to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase six goats for sale

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en:
Phat, who comes from Sa Ang district of Kandal Province, is 35 years old and married.  He is a parent of three kids, who are studying in a local state school. He earns his living via rice farming. To help him in earning a decent income, his wife works at a factory, as a garment worker.

Phat has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. He joins a group comprised of four members, to apply for a latrine loan. As the group's leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy below-the-ground materials for his latrine construction. He highly believes that this purchase will complete the set of things he needs for building a decent latrine for his family, to improve hygienic practice.

loans.use: To buy below-the-ground materials for his latrine construction

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 42-year-old, divorced mother of four children. She lives in small village in the south of Lebanon. She has worked as a tailor for the past twenty years, making wedding dresses and other clothes. She also sells lingerie. Her business is a main source of income for her family’s living. Her children are enrolled in a public school so that they may receive an education that she did not have the opportunity to acquire. 

She decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a loan in order to purchase merchandise for her small business such as lingerie, clothes, and a sewing kit. As for the future, Rima wishes to open up her own clothing shop and increase her revenue in order to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her small business such as lingerie, clothes, and a sewing kit

loans.name: Nidaa

texts.en:
Nidaa is 37 years old and comes from Gaza. She is married and has four children. She is a tailor, and she has owned her small workshop since 2005. There, she makes new clothes or repairs clothes.

She asked Ryada for this loan, in order to buy sewing machines for her tailoring shop. She hopes that this loan will help her increase production and thus, improve her income. She will use her profits to provide her children with a better education.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines for her tailoring shop

loans.name: Puch

texts.en: Puch, a resident of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, is a widowed mother in her late 50s. She has two children. Her one-hectare rice farm is the main source of her family's income. She has been in this business for 30 years and earns about 36,000 KHR per day.  Puch has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and has fully repaid the money she owed us. She has used this money to renovate her house and lease additional land for growing more cash crops. Now, she is requesting a new loan in order to lease more farmland to grow more crops, to buy potash and rice seed, and to pay a plowing fee. She hopes that she can earn more income than before and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy potash and rice seeds, and to pay plowing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Veth's Group

texts.en:
Veth is 53 years old and married. He resides in Banteay Meanchey province. He has eight children. For the sake of the family’s daily food consumption, he grows rice and drives a motor-taxi to generate a decent income. He has been involved in his current business for about 30 years, earning about 30,000 KHR per day.

This is the sixth loan for Veth with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has repaid his previous loans with success. Those loans have enabled him to improve his living conditions, better than before. For this loan cycle, he forms a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy potash and rice seed, and to pay for plowing. He hopes that he can increase his income more, and make a good profit for his family.

loans.use: To buy potash and rice seed, and to pay for plowing

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rope weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her business.

Merle has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from a general store.

Merle has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Yerm's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang province, Yerm is a widowed mother of seven children. She is 55 years old. To support the family, she grows rice on four hectares of her farmland, a main source of her income, and plants corn on one-and-a-half hectares, for extra income. Her current business brings her about 22,200 KHR per day. 

She has successfully paid back her past six cycles with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and the past loans have improved her family's living condition. Now she is seeking a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR while another member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, Yerm will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland as well as to buy a hand tractor to support her farming. She hopes that she can get high crop yield from her business to keep her family's living conditions standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 50 years old and married with two children. Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Ann has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, shampoo, bath soap, snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

Ann would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Zohra's Group

texts.en:
Zohra is a 61-year-old woman, living with her spouse and seven children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a huge family and sometimes it seems very difficult to feed all of them every day. Her husband manufactures plastic bottles, cans and bicycle tires through a compression molding machine. Now her husband has taken an order for manufacturing a new product but he does not have a specific injection-die for manufacturing that product.

Zohra requested a loan of Rs.40,000 from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy new injection-die to fill the new order. Zohra is expecting a positive change in her family's life; she wants to establish her family, her dream being to provide better facilities to her children.
She is very pleased after taking this loan and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Zohra is raising her hand in the picture.

loans.use: To buy dies for Compression Molding Work.

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en: Yeng is 55 years old and a citizen from the Kampong Cham province. Her main source of income is from paddy rice farming and cassava cultivation, with which she has engaged for 21 years. This is Yeng's second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan wisely, to support her living. Now, she is seeking a new loan of 3,500,000 KHR in order to buy additional farmland to expand her agribusiness. She hopes that she can increase yield from her crops and earn more profit in order to buy pigs for raising extra income.

loans.use: to buy additional farmland to expand her agribusiness

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Boma

texts.en:
Boma is a married man with five kids who attend school. His wife is a farmer and together they own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

He has operated a meat goat selling business for the past three years. His potential clients are mostly butchers. He dreams of establishing his own premises for selling goats in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase seven goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase seven goats for resale.

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en:
Etibar is a caring son, husband, and father of two children. He is 39 years old. He earns money for the family by keeping livestock. He has difficulties, like the absence of pasture lands and he has to take animals to the site of the old school. He also wants to improve conditions in the barn for the animals, before winter comes.
 
Etibar's parents are retired, and his family lives with them. His family is in need of their own home and comfort. In order not to leave his parents unattended, he began building his family's house in the same yard with his parents'. He needs money to buy construction materials, so he has applied for a loan in the amount of AZN 1,600.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for use in building a home for his family

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is a 48-year-old married mother. She owns a small convenience store in her village. Two of her children are enrolled in a public school, while the others work in order to cover the family’s increasing needs. However, she has a very big family, which means that she will always need to maximize her profit in order to provide a good life for her ten children. 

Saida decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a loan in order to purchase raw materials and food to expand the capital of her shop. She will buy tinned food, in addition to special summer beverages and Holy Ramadan dates. As for the future, Saida will work hard to accept only direct cash payments from her relatives who buy their needs and do not pay directly to her. They may divide their bills along several months, which is a very bad idea for Saida because she will face a drop in her cash and won’t be capable of increasing her business capital which she is facing right now.

loans.use: To increase her business capital so she can offer special products

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 49 years-old married mother of four children. She has owned a small convenience shop in her village for fourteen years. Her husband is currently unemployed, which means that she is the only financial provider of the family. Her income is not sufficient to provide for a family of six individuals. Her children are enrolled in public high schools to provide them with good education. 

Jamila decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a loan in order to purchase inventory for her shop. She will increase the cold beverages and special offer products. This will be Jamila's ninth loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower with a good paying back history. As for the future, Jamila wishes to expand her shop.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina works hard to support her family. Cristina is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Cristina requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more goods, such as laundry soap, shampoo, milk, noodles, coffee, and other groceries, to sell in her general store.

Cristina has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods, such as laundry soap, shampoo, milk, noodles, coffee, and other groceries, to sell in her general store

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is 37 years old and she lives in the village of Ddmashen, which is in Gegharkunuk region. She is married and has a very nice family. Her husband is very artistic person. He is a musician but unfortunately he has no constant work. They have two children; their son is in the military service and their daughter is still school-aged. 

For three years Armine has worked as a backer, but finally she became engaged in farming and agriculture. She has a plot of land and a very cute farm, where she keeps two cows, a heifer and a calf, plus eight sheep and twenty chickens. Armine works very hard and she manages to have high quality farm product to sell. The meat she sells to the local butchers and the milk she sterilizes and brings to Yerevan goes around the country and sells itself. 

Now Armine needs some support and asks a loan of 700.000 Armenian drams to buy one calve and animal fodder in order to overcome the difficulties of the winter season.

loans.use: to buy one calve and animal fodder in order to overcome the difficulties of the winter season.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
This is already Albert’s second loan with Kiva lenders and he is sure that it will be as productive as the first one. The village Dddmashen, where he and his family continue to live, is in Gegharkunik region. For several years, Albert used to live and work in Russian Federation, but after coming back and getting married, he continues to live in his beloved and sunny village. He lives with his retired mother and his wife, who is teacher of physics (but at this moment she does not work and takes care of their two little children). For three years, Albert has worked at the Sevan bread factory as a baker, but farming and agriculture remain the main source of income for his family. He owns a plot of land, five bulls, and thirty sheep. He also cultivates tomatoes, cucumbers and greens for his family's use.   

Albert needs a loan to buy a lot of animal fodder as well as to buy several sheep, which will bring him good profit in the next year.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder as well as to buy several sheep, which will bring him good profit in the next year

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She operates a tailoring business making suits for both men and women which provides her an income. She sells at the market to local neighbors and passersby. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase materials, sewing threads and needles. She decided to join Yehu to access a loan to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials, sewing threads and needles.

loans.name: Eghish

texts.en:
Eghish, age 27, is a very kind and hard-working, single man. He lives with his retired parents in the small village of Akhalkalaki. Eghish works very hard on his own piece of land, where he grows potatoes. His products are very good quality, and he sells the harvests at the market that is close to where he lives. As his agricultural business is seasonal and the family needs monthly income, Eghish decided to start up his own business. There is a high unemployment rate in the region, and the majority of the inhabitants are self-employed to make a living. 

To be able to start up his business, he is requesting a 3000 GEL loan. His loan request was approved, in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions, to country rural poor people who do not have access to other credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the amount he is asking for, Eghish will set up a metal and plastics workshop. He will purchase materials for making doors and windows. He will manufacture and sell them at a good price, because demand is high in the region. This loan will be a great help for him, to generate revenue and give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase materials for setting up a metal and plastics workshop, to manufacture windows and doors

loans.name: Agasaf

texts.en:
Agasaf is 57 years old and a married man. He is growing fruits and vegetables. He plants tomatoes, potatoes, eggplant and other vegetables and fruits. He knows that even though this business is very hard, together with his wife he has been handling the business for 12 years without any difficulty.
 
Agasaf grows vegetables and fruits and sells them in the bazaar. His income from vegetable and fruit sales is 130 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat). He has more plans for the future, such as to get more land for cultivation. Agasaf is looking forward to the increased sales in the coming summer because people purchase fruits a lot.

He has already taken a loan from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history, he has applied for second loan of 1,000 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of getting new fertilizers and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to generate more revenue in the coming summer, which will help him to support his family’s needs. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 41-year-old married father of six children. He has owned a business where he is in charge of repairing used cars' body work since 1990. His wife is currently unemployed, which means that he is the only financial resource of the family. Hussein has been working in this field for more than 20 years now, which means that he has gained a lot of expertise over the years. 

He decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a loan in order to purchase broken spare parts which he will later fix, reassemble into cars, and sell. As for the future, Hussein wishes to expand his shop.

loans.use: to purchase broken spare parts which he will later fix, reassemble into cars, and sell.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en:
Hakim, a 36-year-old married father of two sons, runs a retail business selling new clothes and footwear. In operation for over 10 years now, he buys his products from the capital city and sells them at the local flea market, earning a monthly profit of 170 azn.

Hakim has requested a loan of 2000 azn to order a variety of stock to increase his business capacity. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to pay for his child's education and to improve his family's lifestyle.

In the future, Hakim plans to open numerous outlets and further increase his business capacity.

loans.use: to buy a variety of stock to increase his business capacity.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is married with four children. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rental bills. 

He operates a clothes selling business, selling from home and door to door to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand his business and he dreams of establishing a boutique shop in the future.

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase four bales of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase four bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is 42 years old and a married woman from a small village of Chokhatauri district.  She lives with her husband Emzar and daughter Rusudan. She is actively involved in agricultural activities with her family members. They have a milk cow, 3 pigs, 3 horses, 2 goats and 4 bee-hives with bee-colonies. Besides that, the family owns a plot of agricultural land, where maize, potatoes and nut trees are grown. They sell the harvested products locally at a good price. 

Liana requested 1100 GEL from Credo to start-up another family business. Liana has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo.
