The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Liana will begin to sell vegetables, such as: potatoes, wheat and so on. Emzar will help her to transport and sell the vegetables in different villages. This will be an additional source of income for their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin selling vegetables

loans.name: Etoile Group

texts.fr: La cliente Regine est vice présidente du collectif d’affaire  «Etoile»,  entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 50 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un enseignant dans une école secondaire. La cliente est vendeuse de poissons. Elle installe ses produits au marché public et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari, Il y a environ 4 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 4 paniers de poissons. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et acheter une parcelle. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Hekima client Regine is the vice-president of the business assocaition called «Etoile» and an experienced entrepreneur. Aged 50, she is married and the mother of two children who are both studying.  Her husband is a teacher in a secondary school. She herself sells fish. She displays her goods at the public market and sometimes at her home. 

She began the business with her own money that she had received from her husband, about four years ago. This new loan will allow her to buy four baskets of fish. In this way, she hopes to grow her business, feed her children and keep them in school, and buy a plot of land. She thanks Hekima sincerely for its support in terms of micro-loans to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy four baskets of fish

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is a married woman with four kids who attend school. Her husband is a farmer, and together they own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a goat-meat selling business for the past two years. Her potential clients are mostly butcher operators and fellow villagers. 

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase six goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase six goats for resale.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en: Peris is married and the mother of two children. She owns a house that has neither electricity and piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and fees the family needs to pay. For the past seven months, she has earned a living by running a food stall, selling her products from home to local customers. She dreams of expanding this business into a café. She is requesting a loan for Kshs 30,000 to buy wheat flour, rice, maize flour, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Tabriz

texts.en: Tabriz is 50 years old, married and the father of one child. He earns a living by running a small café in his city. He has dedicated his life to this business for more than 30 years. Usually his clients are workers from the construction companies in his town. Every morning he goes to the market to buy products for his employees to use to prepare meals to sell. Tabriz’s café is open from 8 am to 12 pm. He is satisfied with his business and his profits come to 150 AZN a month. He is requesting a loan for 2,000 AZN to repair his café and buy new furniture. He has taken out and repaid a previous loan from Aqroinvest. He thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to repair his café and buy new furniture.

loans.name: Zada

texts.en:
Zada is a 46 year-old Lebanese married mother of four children. She owns a small business in which she sells several kinds of clothes for women and children, in addition to lingerie. Her husband has a low-income job related to cement work; therefore, their children are enrolled in a public school, although they dream of providing their children with the best education ever.

Zada contacted Al Majmoua for a third cycle loan to help her business work well. She will start selling bed sheets and and blankets.

In the future, she would like to increase her clientele by diversifying her products.

loans.use: to start selling bed sheets and and blankets.

loans.name: Tiessiriton 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Tiessiriton 1 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Banankoroniwere. dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Fatoumata (deuxième  femme assise à droite dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Banankoroniwere.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des  semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 women of the group known as Tiessiriton 1 are all married in traditional families. They have an average age of 35 and on average three children. They all live in the village of   Banankoroniwere. in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali.) They met through their agricultural, rainy season activities, or through ties of neighborhood, kinship and marriage in the village. They grow peanuts, millet and rice. In order to obtain small equipment and to stock up on agricultural inputs, the members of this group came to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first seasonal loan. 

Madame  Fatoumata (second woman sitting on the right in the photo) works very hard at her rainy season agricultural activities in the village of  Banankoroniwere.  She intends to use her loan to plow her field, to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to pay young people to weed her field. The sale of her produce takes place for cash at the end of the rainy season, to repay her loan and in order to have income to pay for children's expenses and part of those of the extended family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, agricultural inputs, and pay young people to weed her field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: with his rice production

loans.name: Rahbar

texts.ru:
Рахбарой занимается бизнесом около 15 лет, она шьет национальные халаты и матрацы (курпачи). Этому ремеслу научила ее мать. Также ее старшая сестра помогает шить халаты и матрацы, так как это ручная и трудоемкая работа. Рахбарой также дополнительно занимается продажи рыб, как свежей, так и копченной. Она торгует на рынке не каждый день, так как в определенные дни к ней приходят клиенты, которые заказывают в основном свежую рыбу.Рахбарой очень ответственная и добрая женщина.
 Муж Рахбарой печет лепешки в другом регионе, так как в этом регионе на его лепешки большой спрос, поэтому он остается там на 2-3 недели, в остальные дни его заменяет напарник.
 Рахбарой хочет провести дома ремонт, они с мужем решили сделать капитальный ремонт в квартире. На отделку и замену окон уходят большие затраты,а у них не хватает денежных средств , для этого Рахбарой в очередной раз хочет получить кредит и осуществить свои планы.
 На полученный кредит Рахбарой планирует купить строительные материалы.
texts.en:
Rahbar has been in business for around 15 years. She sews national robes and mattresses ("kurpachi'). She learned the craft from her mother. Her sister helps her sew robes and mattresses since it is such manual and time-intensive work. Rahbar also sells fish, both fresh and smoked. She trades in the market every day, because on certain days clients come to her to place orders for fresh fish. Rahbar is a very responsible and kind woman.

Rahbar's husband works baking bread in a different region where there is a lot of demand for his bread.  Because of this, he stays there for 2-3 weeks at a time and on alternate days he is replaced by his partner.

Rahbar wants to do some home repairs. She and her husband decided to make major renovations in their apartment. Window repairs come at a great expense, and since they don't have enough money to cover them, Rahbar wants to receive another loan to carry out her plans. Rahbar plans to use the proceeds to purchase building materials.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour and beans.

loans.name: Vaqif

texts.en:
Vaqif is 50 years old and a married man. He has had his grocery store for 25 years, where he sells sugar, butter, tea, soft drinks, dairy products, bread, coffee, cookies, etc. He has always worked in commerce. His business is located in the interior of his house. He works constantly, beginning with the purchase of all the healthiest and freshest groceries in the city market. Whenever he acquires what he needs, he sells it in his establishment.
 
Vaqif says that running his business is fun and he enjoys it, and now he is very happy with all that he has accomplished as the years have passed. He has many goals, the main one being expanding his shop so that he can offer a greater variety of products to his customers. 

At this time, he is requesting 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat). He is very happy to know that he has a source of economic support so that he can continue advancing toward accomplishing his goals. He promises to pay each of his payments punctually. With the requested amount, he will purchase more merchandise and products to offer to his customers, like rice, sugar, milk and other goods.

loans.use: to buy products to offer to his customers, like rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Abduvali

texts.ru:
Абдували  разводит скот более чем 25 лет. Когда он  был еще  маленьким, он  помогал ухаживать за скотом своим родителям.  Сейчас его  дети  также помогают ему , приносят корм, выводят  скот на пастбище и доят корову. Жена Абдували  домохозяйка, но она по сезонам с июля по ноябрь выкупает виноград с поля у фермеров, содержит в складе-холодильнике и  сдает на рынок.  Сыновья Абдували  днем отгоняют скот на пастбище ,а в это время сам Абдували  ходит на работу так как работает  маляром. Животноводство дает семье Абдували очень хорошую прибыль и поэтому вся семья старается развивать этот бизнес.  
Так как на пастбищах кругом трава и много  различного корма, Абдували  планирует прикупить еще пару коров для дальнейшего разведения. С этой целю он обратился в организацию Арванд и надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Abduvali has been raising cattle for over 25 years. Even when he was very young, he helped his parents take care of cattle. Similarly, his children now help him by bringing feed, herding cattle in the pasture and milking cows. Abduvali's wife stays at home, but seasonally, from July to November, she buys grapes from farmers, stores them in a refrigerated warehouse and sells them on the market. While Abduvali's sons herd cattle in the pasture, he goes to work as a painter. The livestock gives Abduvali's family a good income, so the whole family is working on growing the business.

Since his pasture is full of grass and lot of diverse food, Abduvali plans to buy another pair of cows for additional breeding. To achieve this, he turned to the Arvand organization and hopes for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia, age 61, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income.  

She is a dedicated mother of two; she is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  

For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 20,000 Pakistan rupees to purchase one more goat. She is hopeful to get an increase in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the revenue on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more goat.

loans.name: Shakhovidin

texts.ru: Шаховидин является животноводом, проживающим в городе Исфара. Ему 48 лет, имеет жену, двоих сыновей и одну дочь. Его жена работает в химическом заводе, а старший сын работает мигрантом в загранице. Шаховидин на протяжении 4-х лет занимается овцеводческим бизнесом. Он с юности знает как разводить мелко-рогатый скот. У него сейчас в хозяйстве имеется 15 голов овец для откорма и продажи. Раньше он занимался куплей и продажей овец совместно со своим другом. А теперь он занимается этим бизнесом самостоятельно. В разведении овец ему помогает семья. Для продолжения деятельности Шаховидин нуждается в закупе корма для скота. С этой целью он просит кредит. На сумму кредита он хочет купить корм, в частности сено, ячмень и кукурузу.
texts.en:
Shakhovidin lives in the town of Isfara and works with livestock. He is 48 years old, married and has two sons and one daughter. His wife works in a chemical plant, and his oldest son is a migrant worker abroad. Shakhovidin has over 4 years of experience in the sheep business. From his childhood, he has known how to raise goats and sheep. 

On his farm, he now has 15 sheep for fattening and sale. Previously, he used to buy and sell sheep together with his friend. Now he handles the business independently. His family helps him with breeding the animals. 

To continue his business, Shakhovidin needs to purchase feed for the livestock. It is with this goal that he has applied for a loan. With the loan proceeds, he wants to buy feed, particularly hay, barley and corn.

loans.use: to buy hay, barley and corn as feed for goats and sheep

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 56 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de arroz , con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener una buena  producción , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Jesús is an enterprising man. He is 56, married, and currently lives with his wife. He is requesting a loan with the desire to purchase supplies such as manure and insect spray. He wants to support his rice crops with the goal of keeping them in good conditions during their development in order to obtain a good production. The only limit to his growth is a lack of money. He depends on this work go get ahead, so he is requesting a loan, his first with FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with great ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Dilovarjon

texts.ru: Диловарчон молодой женатый человек в возрасте 26 лет. Он проживает со своей женой в городе Исфара. У него пока нет детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Диловарчон работает в автомастерской. Он в течение 6 лет занимается ремонтом автомобилей. Он научился этому делу у своего старшего брата. Так как Диловарчон выполняет свою работу качественно количество его постоянных клиентов день за днем увеличивается. Он в работе имеет одного помощника. Диловарчон закупает старые автомашины по низкой цене, ремонтирует и выводит их на автомобильный рынок на продажу. Сейчас он намерен расширить свою деятельность. Он просит кредит для закупа запасных частей автомашин с целью ремонта старых автомобилей на продажу. Кредит позволит ему продвинуть деятельность и улучшить жизнь.
texts.en:
Dilovarjon is a young, married 26-year-old man. He lives with his wife in the city of Isfara. He does not have kids yet. His wife is a homemaker. Dilovarjon works in an auto repair shop. He has been repairing cars for six years. He learned his skills from his older brother. 

Since Dilovarjon does high quality work, the number of loyal customers grows every day. He employs one helper at work. Dilovarjon purchases old cars at low prices, fixes them and puts them on the market for sale. 

Now he intents to grow his business. He is requesting a loan to purchase spare car parts to repair old cars for resale. The loan would allow him to expand his business and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare car parts needed to repair old cars for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to get a dental treatment.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en: Ishrat is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She is very talented and excels in making paper bags which are used for the packaging of cement. She makes a large quantity of paper bags at home and sells them in the local market. Through her business she earns enough to contribute to the family income. In order to increase her sales, Ishrat is requesting a loan of 20,000 PKR, which she will use to buy bundles of good quality paper and packs of glue in order to increase her production. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She expects a boost in her earnings through higher sales and wishes to use part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy bundles of good quality paper and glue to make paper bags.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman, and has nine children who attend school. Her husband is a farmer, and together they own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a goat meat selling business for the past ten years. Her potential clients are mostly fellow villagers, and also butchers. She dreams of establishing her own premise to sell goats in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase 5 goats to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase five goats to sell.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, soltera, ya sus hijos estan mayores son independientes, ella tiene un negocio de Comidas rapidas y actualmente quiere realizar unas modificacione en la cocina ya que le esta llendo muy bien y quiere contratar a  una persona que le ayude y las condiciones que tiene la cocina no le presta para lo que ella desea, realizara un nuevo anexo ya que es muy pequeña, ademas comprara abarrotes para la elaboracion de comidas, agradece el apoyo que Afodenic siempe le ha brindado en conjunto a Fondos Kiva
texts.en:
Maria is single and lives in the city of Ticuantepe. Her children are grown up, so they are independent. She has a fast food business and currently wants to make some modifications to the kitchen, since her business is going very well. The condition of her kitchen doesn't meet her needs, and she wants to contract someone to help her.

She will make a new annex (a stall from which she'll sell her food) because her current one is very small. She will also buy groceries to make food. She is thankful for the support that Afodenic has always offered her, along with Kiva Microfunds.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Savina

texts.es: Savina vive en la comunidad de Mojopata y tiene 36 años de edad, ella se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y cuyes. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Savina lives in the community of Mojopata and is 36 years old. She works in agriculture and raises small animals like guinea pigs and hens. She has had this business for several years now, and it is going very well for her thanks to her hard work. She belongs to the "Sol Naciente de Mojopata" communal bank, and she needs this loan to buy seeds and guinea pigs. She is grateful for this loan, and values it. She promises to repay her monthly quotas with a great level of responsibility. 
(The community of Mojopata is located in the Challabamba district, in the province of Puacartambo, Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to buy seeds and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with three kids who attend school. Her husband is a farmer and together they own a house that has neither electricity nor running water.

She has operated a business selling goat meat for the past three years. She dreams of establishing a wholesale food shop as another business in the future.

With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase eight goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase eight goats for resale.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 21 and lives in Sana'a, Yemen.

He is a hardworking man who likes to depend on himself. He is employed in the public sector, but is getting a low salary. Over time, he has collected a small amount and intends to buy a taxi.  However, he knows that it costs more money, and he doesn't yet have enough money to purchase a taxi. 

He applied for a youth loan of 450,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB to buy a taxi to increase his daily income. He hopes to improve his living standards and own a house.

loans.use: to buy a taxi to increase his daily income.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe De Santa Clara Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 6  socios responsables a distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellos residen en el distrito de ate santa clara. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “virgen de Guadalupe de santa clara” una de ellas es la Sra. Blanca  de 57  años de edad casada. La Sra. blanca se dedica ya hace 20 años al  servicio de lavandería  En un pequeño local  todos los días con el merito de salir adelante y así poder pagar los gastos de su casa, su mayor deseo es tener una lavandería propia y así salir adelante la Sra. Blanca Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más insumos (detergentes líquidos, suavizantes, solvente para lavado al seco etc.) para el servicio de lavandería  y así poder tener más ingresos. La Sra. Blanca es la primera de la mano izquierda se le observa enseñando el cheque A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo  diciéndoles que cumplirá todas su metas propuestas.
texts.en: This group, Virgen de Guadalupe de Santa Clara, is made up of six responsible members who have distinct businesses. They all live in the district of Ate Santa Clara. One of the group members is Blanca, age 57, who is married. She has provided a laundry service for 20 years. She works in a small space every day with the goal of getting ahead and being able to cover her household costs. Her greatest desire is to have her own laundromat business and to succeed. Blanca will use this loan to invest in the purchase of more supplies (liquid detergents, softeners, dry cleaning solvent, etc) for her laundry service in order to have more income. Blanca is pictured first on the left, holding the cheque. She says goodbye with a hug for Kiva and Edaprospo, promising that she will achieve all of her goals.

loans.use: to buy liquid detergents.

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Mujeres Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
DUO SOLIDARIO MUJERES VENCEDORAS
ESTE DUO ESTA CONFORMADO POR DOÑA JOCABED ABIGAHIL, ORIGINARIA DE SAN MARTIN JILOTEPEQUE, JOCABED POSEE DESDE HACE YA MAS DE CINCO AÑOS LA VENTA DE TORTILLAS Y COMO ACTIVIDAD SECUNDARIA SE DEDICA A ELABORAR TEJIDOS TIPICOS ELLA ES MADRES DE FAMILIA Y UNA PERSONA MUY LUCHADORA Y CON MUCHAS GANAS DE BRINDARLE SIEMPRE LO MEJOR A SU FAMILIA. ESTE ES EL SEGUNDO CREDITO QUE SOLICITAN. YA TRABAJO UN CREDITO Y ES UNA PERSONA MUY RESPONSABLE EN SUS PAGSO, ELLAS SOLICITAN EL CREDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR ARTICULOS PARA SEGUIR CRECIENDO EN SU NEGOCIO E INVERTIR MAS PARA ASI OFRECER UN MEJOR SERVICIO A SUS CLIENTES ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE MAIZ PARA LA ELABORACION DE TORTILLAS PARA LA VENTA Y PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA PARA LA ELABORACION DE TEJIDOS TIPICOS.
texts.en:
Mujeres Vencedoras Solidarity Duo
This duo includes Jocabed Abigahil, from San Martin Jilitepeque. Jocabed has had a business selling tortillas for over five years. As a secondary business, she makes traditional textiles. She is a mother and a fighter. She has a great desire to always offer her family the very best. 
This is the duo's second loan. Jocabed has already worked with one loan and she is very responsible in her payments. The group is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy items to continue expanding their businesses and to invest more in order to offer better customer service. They are requesting this loan for the purchase of corn for making tortillas for sale, and for the purchase of basic materials for making traditional textiles.

loans.use: to buy corn for making tortillas, and for the purchase of basic materials for making traditional textiles.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is married and has been blessed with two children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a tailoring business, making school uniforms and suits for both men and women. In addition, she also has a business selling food in a shop. Her challenge in this business is seasonality.

With this 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread, and needles for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread, and needles for her business.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is a married woman and has one child. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop. Her potential customers are market dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge due to price fluctuations in the products in the market.

With this loan of 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase five sacks of beans, four litres of cooking  oil, two bundles of wheat flour and one bag of rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of beans, four litres of cooking oil, two bundles of wheat flour and one bag of rice.

loans.name: Lumturi

texts.en:
Lumturi is an Egyptian Albanian who has been a long-time client of VisionFund Albania. She lives in a village in southeastern Albania and agriculture is the activity that she has been practicing for almost all of the past ten years.

“I like planting and harvesting and selling my fresh produce. Selling runs in my blood; almost everyone in my ethnic community has some talents when it comes to selling, but not very many in my community do what I do, agriculture,” she said with a smile. 

Lumturi wants to buy watering pumps, and this loan will help her achieve the goal.

loans.use: to buy watering pumps.

loans.name: Jhondy

texts.en:
Jhondy is 18 years old and lives with his family. He is studying administration at university level. In his second year, Jhondy dedicates 10 hours every day to his studies. In addition, he also works with his parents during his free time in order to lighten the burden of his parents.

With the support from this loan, Jhondy plans to cover the cost of books and study materials. He is grateful for this opportunity and the support he has received, and he plans to put his studies first in order to gain success and be able to help his parents in the future.

loans.use: to pay for books and study materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to order clothes and footwear to sell in her business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es madre de tres hijos de los cuales dos están a su cargo, uno de ellos nació con capacidad diferente al que le tiene que dar un cuido especial, el tiene 21 años, ella se apoya con su esposo en los gastos  del hogar. Doña Carmen continua con su pequeña pulpería ubicada en su casa que a la vez hace tortillas para equilibra los gastos del hogar, en la actualidad necesita invertirle con más productos a su negocio ya que no tiene muchos en el inventario el cual no debe descuidarlo porque es el sustento diario de la familia. Es por eso que solicita el crédito para comprar granos básicos, gaseosas, lácteos, enlatados, productos del aseo del hogar y personal, todos los mencionados de la demanda de sus clientes, los vecinos del barrio.
texts.en:
Carmen is the mother of three children, all of whom are in her care.  One of them was born with a different capacity, and she therefore needs to give him special care; he is twenty-one years old.  She and her husband work to cover the home expenses.  Carmen continues with her small grocery store, which is located in her house.  She also makes tortillas in order to balance the home expenses.  

Presently, she needs to invest in more products for her business because she currently doesn't have a lot of inventory.  She cannot ignore this because the store provides daily sustenance for her family.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan that she will use to buy basic food items, carbonated beverages, milk products, canned items, and products for cleaning, home, and personal use.  All of the mentioned items are based on the demand of her customers, who are her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy basic food items, carbonated beverages, milk products, canned items, and products for cleaning, home, and personal use.

loans.name: Nineli

texts.en:
Nineli is 51 years old. She lives in the Terjola District with her husband and two children. The family runs a small dairy farm of two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. The cheese is sold at the local open market. Besides dairy farming, Nineli works very hard on her own piece of land where she grows different kinds of vegetables. Her products are very good quality, and she sells the harvests at the different markets that are close to where she lives.

All of the family members work hard, but the income is not enough for covering the everyday expenses. So, Nineli decided to start up a new business. She has requested loans from her local financial institutions several times without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and the lack of experience in the new job, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. 

Her loan request was approved under a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the loan, Nineli will build a greenhouse. She will purchase building materials and construct it. Nineli will plant different kinds of greens and vegetables, which will be sold by her at a good price. This will increase her income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family. Nineli awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Phares

texts.en:
Phares lives in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya. He is married and has four children, three of whom are of school-going age. 

Phares has practiced mixed farming for 13 years. His main source of income is coffee, bananas, maize and beans. In addition to farming, he has a motorbike for transport.

He has applied to Juhudi Kilimo for a loan of KES.60,000 to purchase irrigation equipment. This will ensure a good supply of water throughout the farm, and help to produce a greater harvest. This will help boost his income base, and improve the family's living standards. In future, he hopes to purchase a milk processing machine. The major challenge that Phares faces is that of inadequate funds.

Phares says that Juhudl Kilimo's services are excellent and admirable to clients.

loans.use: to purchase irrigation equipment to ensure a good supply of water throughout his farm.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya, a very fertile area for agriculture. She is married and has three children. Florence has been farming for 18 years. Her main source of income is melons, tobacco, maize, beans and bananas.

Florence wants to venture into milk production, and therefore has requested a loan of KES.30,000 from Juhudi Kilimo for purchasing dairy goats. This loan will help her to improve her living standards, and also increase food production. The main challenge Florence faces, is the high cost of living. In the future, she wants to to operate a butchery business for selling goat meat.

Florence says that she will make maximum use of Juhudi Kilimo's funds transfer to boost her projects.

loans.use: to purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter tiene  38 años de edad, está casado y  vive en su casa propia junto su madre, su esposa, y sus 2 hijos. Walter se dedica a la venta de repuestos y servicio de taller para motos, para eso cuenta con una tienda multiservicio instalado en un local alquilado, donde atiende los pedidos de sus clientes que le confían la reparación de sus vehículos. Se inició hace más de 10 años con un capital propio, comprando y vendiendo en pequeñas cantidades luego aumentando su stock de mercaderías con las ganancias que obtenía y hasta el momento lo viene realizando con el apoyo de su pareja en el servicio del taller. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y la demanda que tiene estos productos. Su esposa le ánimo a empezar este negocio para aumentar sus ingresos y no pasar necesidades, buscando brindar una mejor calidad de visa a sus hijos. Por tanto viendo el buen resultado que sigue teniendo, desea comprar la casa donde alquila su local, así ahorrarse gastos de alquiler,  también  abrir otra sucursal para ver crecer su negocio. Esto es su quinto préstamo con kiva.  Esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad económica. Con el monto de S./ 1200 invertirá en la compra de lubricantes para su tienda en cajas al por mayor para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Walter is 38 years old and married.  He lives in his own house with his mother, his wife, and their two children.  Walter sells replacement parts and provides service for motorcycles.  In order to do so, he has a multi-service store installed in a place that he rents.  

That is where he tends to the orders, which his customers place with him.  They trust him to repair their vehicles.  He started over ten years ago with his own capital.  He was buying and selling in small quantities.  Then he increased his stock of merchandise with the earnings that he got. His life partner helps him with the service in his workshop.

He believes that his business is pretty profitable because of the earnings that it gives him and the demand that these products have.  His wife encouraged him to start this business in order to increase his income, to not be in need, and to give their children a better quality of life.  

Seeing the good results that he continues having, he wishes to buy the house that he rents for his place.  This way he will save the rental expense.  He will also open another branch in order to see his business grow.

This is his fifth loan with Kiva.  He is very grateful for the financial opportunity.  He will use the 1,200 soles to buy wholesale cases of lubricants for his store in order to get more earnings.

loans.use: to buy lubricants, among other motorcycle items, for his store.

loans.name: Patrice

texts.en:
Patrice is 26 years old and lives in the village of Kooki County, in rural Kyotera. He has a family of two children, who he takes care of along with his wife.

Patrice earns a living from dealing in seasonal coffee production. He has been in this business for the last three years. He says that he has managed to expand his income from a small subsistence to a fairly large income that has allowed him to send his children to school. Patrice attributes his success to the first loan that Ugafode accorded him.

He has now managed to set up a plastics shop with a branch in neighboring Buyamba town and the other he says is in south Sudan. Patrice says he been able to boost his capital from the previous Ugafode loan that has allowed him run the two plastics shops. However, he confesses that his main challenge is co-coordinating the two branches which are quite distant from each other, and also the fact that business in south Sudan is quite expensive.

He hopes to use this loan to present a wide variety of items that clients ask for.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Tulio

texts.es: Tulio tiene 38 años está casado y  vive en su casa junto su esposa y sus 3 hijos. Tulio se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos comestibles, tiene una pequeña tienda que ha puesto en el interior de su  casa propia.  Hace un año empezó su negocio, pero también trabaja como estibador en el puerto fluvial de la ciudad, ahí se encarga de cargar y descargar los botes y canoas que llegan repletos de mercaderías. Aunque pase unos malos momentos, siempre cuente con el apoyo de su familia. Esto es el tercer préstamo con Kiva, agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en él para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto de S./ 1000 soles comprará productos para su tienda de productos comestibles ya que desea surtir su tienda con mayor diversidad de productos de distintas marcas.
texts.en:
Tulio, age 38, live in his house with his wife and their three children.  Tulio sells all types of food products.  He has a small store that he has placed inside of his own house.  He started his business one year ago.  However, he also works as a longshoreman at the city’s waterfront.  That is where he loads and unloads boats and canoes that arrive full of merchandise.  Even though he has some bad times, he always has his family’s support.

This is his third loan with Kiva.  He is grateful for the opportunity and the trust shown in him in order to receive this loan.  He pledges to make his payments punctually.  He will use the 1,000 soles to buy food products for his store.  He wishes to stock his store with a greater diversity of different brands of products.

loans.use: to buy various food products like rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Lirie

texts.en:
Lirie is a talented seamstress who hasn’t gone to any school to learn the skills she has been practicing during these past ten years.

Lirie advised: "My husband passed away long ago, leaving me helpless and hopeless. I was only 26 and now I had to care for four little ones. I did not know what to do. I was lost in my grief for a long time. My whole world was shattered and I could not let go of the grief. It was strong and I suffered, no doubt. But at the same time I had to get up and think about my children, who needed to be fed and educated. This is what made me start the clothing alterations at first and then gradually I got to the sewing activity. I stitch curtains, drapes, sheets and pillow cases and some other things”. 

Lirie is pictured with some her her finished items. With this loan, Lirie would like to buy some fabric and other raw materials.

loans.use: to buy raw fabric material for her sewing business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
This group of women from south Iraq requested to remain anonymous on Kiva. 

One of the group members is a 58-year-old woman who is marrried and has seven children. With limited career options, due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, she is one of the many Iraqi women who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has ten years of experience with her home based sewing business activity, and to improve the services she can offer her customers as well as improve her work conditions, she would like to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine. To be able to make this purchase, she took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq. 

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers 'group loans' for clients unable to provide a guarantor, and are therefore unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about these borrowers has been altered for their protection. Relief International Microfinance Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to venture into horticultural farming.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is married with one child. They live in their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food. 

She has operated a lesso/khanga (women's wrap clothing) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business. She dreams of establishing a boutique shop in the future.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase one bale of khanga for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of khanga to re-sell.

loans.name: Wakati

texts.en:
Wakati has operated a food-selling business, selling breads from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, and blue band for her bakery business.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, and  blue band  for her bakery business.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 21 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past four years, Diana has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, milk and bread. 

To help expand her business, Diana has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items such as milk, soup and bread for the store to sell. This will help Diana to generate greater profits and complete her parents residential house. Diana hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into a wholesale shop. 

Diana is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Diana who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase for more items to sell in her store, such as milk, soup and bread.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi operates a food stall business where she sells cashew nuts to local customers. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With this 40,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase 6 sacks of cashew nuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she appreciates for the support.

loans.use: to purchase 6 sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a green grocery shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high competition from other green grocery stores and she dreams of establishing a fruit parlor in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting, Mwanasha wants to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Ahmad's Group

texts.en:
Ahmad is a young man from south Iraq. He is 29 years old, sinlge and lives with his family - as customs and traditions prescribe. 

To generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of his family, he has a small mobile phone shop. He has five years of experience with the shop, and to make sure he can meet the demands of his customers and also offer them competitive goods and services, he would like to improve the quality and quantity of his stock of goods and purchase new models for retailing. To be able to make this purchase, he took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq. 

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers 'group loans' for clients unable to provide a guarantor, and therefore unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about these borrowers has been altered for their protection. Relief International Microfinance Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to improve the quality and quantity of his stock of goods and purchase new models of mobile phones for retailing.

loans.name: Inom

texts.ru: Ином жизнерадостный и очень трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 35 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Все вместе они живут в маленькой деревне. Жена Инома домохозяйка, она ухаживает и заботится о своих детях, а также занимается домашними делами. Доход в семье имеется только от бизнеса Инома. Ином занимается купля продажей мужской обуви. Он закупает мужскую обувь на большом оптовом базаре в городе, и привозит в свою деревню для продажи. Этим делом он занимается уже несколько лет, и получает хороший доход от этого бизнеса. Но Ином мечтает иметь больше дохода каждый месяц, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды и потребности своей семьи. А также его дети учатся в школе и их образование требует много финансовых затрат, на оплату обучения, покупку необходимого инвентаря,  а также школьной одежды. Поэтому Ином старается расширить свой бизнес и увеличить товарооборот. В данный момент он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит, чтобы закупить больше различной мужской обуви. Он хочет расширить ассортимент своего товара. Ином надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Inom is a joyous and hard working man of the age of 35. He is married and has two children. They live together in a small village. Inom's wife is a housewife, she looks after and takes care of the children, and she also does domestic chores. Only Inom's business gives the family income. 

Inom works with buying and reselling men's shoes. He purchases men's shoes at a large wholesale market in the city and brings them to his village to sell. He has worked with this activity for several years already, and receives a good income from this business. But Inom dreams of having  a larger income every month, in order to meet his family's needs and requirements with quality. Also, his children go to school and their education has a financial cost, such as paying for education, purchasing necessary equipment and also school clothing. 

Therefore, Inom tries to expand his business and increase the turnover. Currently he turned to Arvand, and would like to receive a loan in order to purchase more men's shoes. He hopes to expand his assortment of goods. Inom hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to expand his assortment of goods

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба 43-летняя вдова с четырьмя детьми. У нее двое сыновей и двое дочерей в возрасте от 17 лет до 21 года. Они проживают в городе Куляб. Старший сын Махбубы в данное время находится на заработках в загранице, младший сын студент, старшая дочь работает вместе с матерью, а вторая дочь домохозяйка. Махбуба одна воспитала детей и обеспечивает семью. В течение 10 лет Махбуба работает в сфере торговли и имеет хороший опыт. Она занимается продажей женской одежды и женского нижнего белья на рынке города. Прибыль, получаемый с деятельности она тратит на семейные расходы и продвигает бизнес. Сейчас она нуждается в кредите. Махбуба просит кредит для закупа ассортимента сезонной женской одежды и женского нижнего белья для развития бизнеса.
texts.en:
Mahbuba is a 43-year old widow with four children. She has two sons and two daughters of the age of 17 and 21. They live in the city of Kulob. Mahbuba's eldest son is currently abroad as a migrant worker, the youngest son is a student, the eldest daughter works together with her mother and the other daughter is a housewife. 

Mahbuba raised the children alone and she supports the family. For a period of 10 years, Mahbuba worked with sales, and she has a large experience. She works with selling women's clothing and underwear at the local market. She spends the income received from the business on family's expenses and on managing the business. 

Currently she needs a loan. Mahbuba requests a loan for the purchase of an assortment of women's clothing and underwear, for expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of seasonal women's clothing and underwear, for developing her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some animal fodder for the winter season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
This group of women from south Iraq requested to remain anonymous on Kiva. 

One of the group members is a 41-year-old woman who is marrried and has four children. With limited career options, due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, she is one of the many Iraqi women who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has ten years of experience with her home based sewing business activity, and to improve the services she can offer her customers as well as improve her work conditions she would like to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine. To be able to make this purchase she took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq. 

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers 'group loans' for clients unable to provide a guarantor, and therefore unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about these borrowers has been altered for their protection. Relief International Microfinance Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора честная и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Гулнора, так как живет вместе со своей семьей в сельской местности, занимается откармливанием скота. Гулнора занимается этим бизнесом уже более 10 лет. Она имеет большой опыт и обучает своих детей этому бизнесу. Ее дети Бурхон, Ойзода, Худойберди и Рахмонберди, а также ее муж Рауф помогают ей введению бизнеса. Этот бизнес является основным источником ее большой семьи и единственной надеждой для будущего развития. Гулнора несколько лет назад начала стройку нового дома для ее старшего сына и его будущей жены. Она хочет женить сына, но сначала она должна достроить дом. Гулнора планирует завершить стройку дома до зимы. С такой целью она обратилась за займом для того, чтобы купить цемент, древесину, кирпич, арматуру и т.п. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulnora is an honest and hardworking woman. She is 47 years old. She is married and raising four children. Gulnora, as she lives in a rural area together with her family, works with livestock breeding. She has worked with this business for 10 years already. She has a large experience and teaches her children this business. Her children, Burkhon, Oyzoda, Khudoyberdi and Rahmonberdi, and also her husband Rauf, help her with managing the business. This business is the main source of income for her large family and their only hope for the future. 

Gulnora started building a new house several years ago, for her eldest son and his future wife. She would like to marry away her son, but first she should finish the house. Gulnora plans to complete the building before the winter. With this aim she applied for a loan, in order to purchase cement, wood, brick, armature and so on. She requests a loan in the amount of 3,000 US dollar. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, brick, wood and armature, for building house

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a hardworking woman who works hard to meet the needs of her family.

Her previous Kiva loan helped her to boost her business. She is now requesting another loan of KES 40,000 to buy eleven sacks of cashew nuts to re-sell. In addition, she also runs a restaurant to supplement her income and she appreciates the support given.

loans.use: to buy eleven sacks of cashew nuts to re-sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant bananas on her farm.

loans.name: Ramazan

texts.en:
Ramazan is a member of the ethnic vulnerable minority community of Egyptian Albanians. He now lives in a village with his wife and two grown-up children, but before that, just like almost every other Egyptian, he was living in a rural area.
 
Ramazan said "the democracy in Albania these past 20 years brought so many positive changes to our community that we are grateful for; we live just like everyone else and there is no stigma associated to our community anymore. We can also live wherever we wish, without being told how and where to live. We live a normal and happy life just like others and we are extremely thankful to the newest government systems”.

Ramazan has been making tools for the past ten years and now he wants to buy some more iron material to produce them.

loans.use: to buy some iron materials to produce tools.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

Asha has operated a beauty salon for the past 20 years at the market. Her customers are passers-by and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan, she wants to add hair braids, shampoo, and manicure services to her beauty salon. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to add hair braids, shampoo and manicure services

loans.name: Kagongi New Dawn Farmers Group

texts.en:
Kagongi New Dawn is a group of roadside vendors with small grocery stores, farms and livestock. The group is composed of widows, divorcees and single parents.

Winfred happens to be one of the divorced members. She has four school-going children. She sometimes gets support from her in-laws, however she finds it inadequate to support her family, so she operates a roadside grocery store which sells fresh fruit and vegetables, from which she earns supplementary income. 

She thanks the group members for standing by each others side to improve the livelihoods of their families and children in particular.

loans.use: to buy passionfruit, mangoes and bananas to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Sabah's Group

texts.en:
Shaba, a young man from southern Iraq, is a member of this group of three men. He is 23 years old, single, and lives with his family according to tradition. To generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of his family, he has operated a fruit and vegetable shop for five years already.

Shaba would like to improve the shop with better storage and display of his goods, and so wants to buy a special stand used in shops similar to his. The stand will allow him to keep his products fresh and allow him to display them so that his customers have better views of and access to them. A loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq will allow him to do this.

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers 'group loans' for clients unable to provide a guarantor, thereby precluding individual loans. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about these borrowers has been altered for their protection. Relief International Microfinance Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a special stand to display his fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a special stand to display his fruit and vegetables in his shop.

loans.name: Fadhila's Group

texts.en:
Fadhila and her group are from south Iraq. Fadhila is a 62-year-old woman who is marrried and has four children. With limited career options, due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, she is one of the many Iraqi women who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has 20 years of experience with her home based sewing business activity, and to improve the services she can offer her customers as well as improve her work conditions, she would like to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine. To be able to make this purchase she took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq. 

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers 'group loans' for clients unable to provide a guarantor, and therefore unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about these borrowers has been altered for their protection. Relief International Microfinance Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For the past five years, she has operated a cafe business, selling food from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the loan of KES 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, sugar and cooking fat for her food preparation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, sugar and cooking fat for her food preparation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a special stand to use in his fruit and vegetables shop.

loans.name: Hamid's Group

texts.en:
Hamid is a 59-year-old man from south Iraq. He is married and has 4 children. Despite unstable circumstances, in the last five years he was able to meet the financial needs of his family by running a small market.

While there have been difficulties in making sure the store has sufficient goods, Hamid has been able to keep his customers, to whom he would like to offer quality goods and services. He would like to improve the stock of goods and increase his inventory. To be able to make this purchase, he took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq. 

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers 'group loans' for clients unable to provide a guarantor, and are thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about these borrowers has been altered for their protection. Relief International Microfinance Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to improve the stock of goods and increase his inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a special display stand for fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Mujeres Con Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Dúo solidario Mujeres con esperanza
la señora Lidia Veronica, de 46 años de edad, quien se dedica a la venta de anillos, cadenas, aretes , pulseras, dijes de oro y plata, también vende cosméticos por catalogo y los fines de semana elabora comida para la venta.  Ella tiene varios pedidos de joyería y para no quedarles mal a sus clientes nuevamente hace  la cuarta solicitud para un crédito ya que necesita comprar las joyas que le hacen falta y no cuenta con todo el dinero que debe llevar a la tienda de joyas, esta contenta porque gracias a Dios y a los creditos otorgados ella ha aumentado sus ventas y dia a dia va creciendo su negocio les agradese de todo corazon su ayuda y espera que le puedan seguir ayudando con su negocio.
texts.en:
Dúo Solidario: Mujeres con esperanza (Women with hope)
Lidia Veronica, who is 46 years old, sells rings, chains, earrings, bracelets and gold and silver charms. She also sells cosmetics via catalog and on the weekends she makes ​​food to sell. 

She has several jewelry orders and does not want to disappoint her customers. Once again, she is requesting a fourth loan to buy the jewelry that she needs. She does not have all the money that she needs to bring to the jewelry store. 

Thanks to God and the granted loans, she is happy and has increased her sales and is growing her business every day, she thanks Kiva lenders wholeheartedly and hopes that they will be able to  continue to help her with her business.

loans.use: to buy gold and silver jewelry to sell

loans.name: Byron Jesús

texts.es: Byron Jesús, tiene la edad  de 20 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  materiales para poder hacer la construcción de un local donde pueda tener y desarrollar algunos cerdos para el engorde.  La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene y las buenas condiciones para ubicar un chiquero  para los cerdos. Además de obtener unos cerdos de buena calidad que a corto plazo puedan estar gordos y de buena calidad. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar la actividad, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en el proyecto y a la vez darle más ingresos económicos a su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Byron Jesús is 20 years old and single. He lives with his parents and siblings, who are his top priority. With this loan, he intends to buy materials for building a pen where he can keep and raise a few pigs for fattening. His idea is to take advantage of an existing space and the good conditions for building a sty for the pigs. In addition, he will obtain a few pigs of good breed that he can fatten in the short term so that they will be of good quality. By making this purchase, he will be able to develop his business. Over time Byron can use his savings to acquire more animals and invest more in his business. As a result, he will have more income for his family.

This is the first time he has received a loan from FUDECOSUR. Byron has not had any other previous loans with the state banks, so FUDECOSUR is offering this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy pigs for fattening and materials for building a pen.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is married and blessed with two children. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and medical expenses. 

She operates a clothes-selling business, selling women’s and gents’ suits in a shop. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other clothes operators to be her major challenges. 

With the KES 40,000, Salama wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale at her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale at her business.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 40 years old. She sells different items in the business she has been running for the past three years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more soaps and salt for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more soaps and salt for sale.

loans.name: Solange Maria

texts.es: Solange tiene 3 años con un negocio de ventas de manera independiente ofreciendo a sus clientes la oportunidad de adquirir electrodomésticos, ropas y accesorios de una manera fácil y económica. Ella frecuentemente compra pacas de ropas para revender y en esta ocasión quiere un préstamo de $10,600 pesos para comprar una paca y así tener más mercancía para la venta. Solange confía en que poco a poco con estas inversiones su negocio ira creciendo hasta poder tener un local para vender.
texts.en:
Solange has been in business for three years as an independent salesperson. She offers her customers the opportunity to acquire household appliances, clothing, and accessories in a manner that is both easy and affordable.

Solange frequently buys bundles of clothing to resell. On this occasion, she is requesting a loan of 10,600 DOP in order to buy one bundle so that she will have more merchandise to sell. She is confident that little by little, these investments will grow her business to the point that she can have her own retail shop.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Doña Eulalia con 54 años de edad es una mujer fuerte, con muchos sueños, muchas metas, esperanzas de que algún día sus cultivos de café sean los mejores y las más productivos de la zona. Ella es ama de casa y agricultora madre de 4 hijos los cuales 2 de ellos viven bajo su mismo techo y se involucran en las diferentes actividades del campo junto a su padre. Con ella también 4 nietos menores de edad y una nuera la cual ayuda con los diferente quehaceres en el hogar como limpieza, cocina, lavado entre otros. Ella en compañía de su familia se ha dedicado desde toda una vida a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café y hoy en día junto a su compañero de hogar no es la excepción siendo ellos agricultores. La tierra que ella en compañía de su familia trabaja en propia gracias al esfuerzo que han puesto por muchos años ubicada a una distancia de 2 kilómetros de su casa de habitación y trasladándose a pie diariamente.

Hoy en día ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento el cual ayudara a mantener su cosecha limpia de plagas, enfermedades entre otros comprando los diferentes insumos que ayudan a que esto sea posible. 

Sus planes son los de mejorar sus cosechas implementando un sistema de riego y manteniéndola sana, limpia y atractiva para sus clientes ya que de esa forma ella dejara a sus hijos un patrimonio fortalecido para poder enfrentar los problemas económicos de manera favorable.
texts.en:
Eulalia, 54, is a strong woman who has a lot of dreams and goals, who hopes that someday her coffee crops will be the best and most productive in the area.  She is a housewife, farmer and mother of 4.  Two of her children live under her roof, and are involved in the various activities in the field with their father.  She also has 4 grandchildren with her who are minors, and a daughter-in-law who helps her with the various household tasks such as cleaning, cooking, washing, among others.  Along with her family, Eulalia has devoted all of her life to farming, particularly the cultivation of coffee.  Now she continues to work in agriculture with her partner.  The land that she and her family work is their own, thanks to their efforts over many years.  It is located 2 kilometers from their house, and they walk there daily.

At this time, Eulalia is requesting a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative to help her maintain her crops and keep them free of pests and diseases.  She will buy various farming supplies to help her make this possible. 

Eulalia's plans for the future include improving her harvests by installing an irrigation system and keeping her crops healthy, clean and attractive to her customers.  In this way, she will leave her children property that has been improved, so that they will be able to face future economic challenges in a favorable way.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers, plant food, and other supplies for her coffee crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a special stand to display his fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Nsene

texts.en:
Nsene operates a clothes-selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business. She dreams of establishing a boutique shop in the future.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase three bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

She appreciates the previous Kiva loan, which helped her to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, vive con sus dos hijos de 12 y 15 años de edad, su esposo de 80 años de edad, los cuales todos le ayudan en su actividad, ya que ella se dedica a la confección y venta de vestidos, dicho oficio lo realiza desde hace 20 años y lo desempeña todos los días.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar materia prima tales como: hilos, botones, zippers, telas entre otros gastos; esta inversión le ayudara al fortalecimiento del negocio  y realizar unos trámites personales.
Su sueño es adquirir un buen negocio para aportar a su familia y así brindarles  una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her two children who are 12 and 15 years old and her husband who is 80 years old. They all help out with her business as she makes a living in dressmaking and sales. She has had this occupation for 20 years and she works at it every day. 

The loan she is requesting will allow her to buy basic materials like thread, buttons, zippers, fabric and to pay for other expenses. This investment will help her to strengthen the business as well as allow her to carry out some personal things. 

Her dream is to have a good business that will support her family and give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy thread, buttons, zippers, fabric, and to cover other expenses.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married and blessed with four children who are adults. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

Mwanakombo operates a clothes-selling business, selling women’s and men’s suits in a shop. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other clothes operators to be her major challenge. 

With the Kshs. 50,000, she wants to purchase four bales of clothes for resale at her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase four bales of clothes for resale at her business.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a 22-year-old micro-entrepreneur. She lives in a rented house in the mining town of Chingola. She is engaged to be married this year and recently expanded her Zoona business after opening a new mobile money transfer shop in the nearby border town of Kasumbalesa.

This is Constance’s second loan; she used the money from her first loan to increase her working capital so that she could serve her customers who wanted to send larger amounts of money. She says the loan was very helpful in the growth of her business because she is now able to serve more customers who come to send and receive money from her Chingola outlet and no longer has to turn them away. Her earnings have also improved and she is excited about the growth of her business. She has even employed two more people to help her run the shops.

Constance is taking out another loan for her new shop in Kasumbalesa. The loan will be used as working capital float for her new outlet. Right now, the Kasumbalesa shop is working on a minimal working capital float of $1,000. This is not enough to satisfy the growing customer base in the thriving border town. The loan will help Constance grow her business.

In this picture, Constance (in the center) poses with her two employees.

loans.use: To increase her working capital so that she can grow her mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, now 29 years old, has been running his Zoona money transfer business for three years. He got his first Kiva loan last year and has fully repaid it. The loan helped Paul to grow his business. He was able to serve more customers and make enough commissions from his first shop to open another mobile money transfers shop in his hometown of Kabwe. Today, Paul now has three employees.

Paul is requesting a second loan so that he can open a third mobile money transfer outlet in his hometown and continue to grow his Zoona mobile money transfer business. He says the Kiva loan will help him satisfy the demand from his customers. Paul is the only Zoona mobile money agent in Kabwe and this puts pressure on him to always have money to serve customers. He would like to open a third shop to meet the growing demand and reduce some of the congestion that has accumulated at his two other shops. Paul will use his Kiva loan to purchase a trading booth, hire two more people, purchase two phones and add to his working capital.

Paul would like to thank his Kiva lenders for their assistance. As a young micro-entropreneur in Zambia, he says working capital finance is very difficult to find and therefore, he has appreciated the opportunity to be linked to Kiva lenders. He is now renting a better house closer to his town where his businesses are located.

loans.use: To grow his Zoona mobile money transfer business by opening a new outlet in his hometown of Kabwe.

loans.name: Swalehe

texts.en:
Swalehe is a divorced man with three kids who attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

He has operated a motorcycle business for the past four years. His potential clients are mostly his fellow neighbors and villagers. 

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase an extra motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase an extra motorcycle.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a hardworking single mother of two girls. She has been running her mobile money transfers business for nearly four years and now has two outlets in Solwezi. She is requesting a second Kiva loan so that she can continue to grow her business. 

Even though Angela has enjoyed some success, securing working capital for her business still remains a significant challenge since she does not have the collateral required for a bank loan.  It is for this reason that Angela has requested another Kiva loan. 

Angela is hopeful that once the Kiva loan comes in, the additional working capital will enable her to serve more customers in the busy mining town of Solwezi. Given the high demand to send and receive money, Angela knows that increasing her float is the key to growing her profits and improving her family's well being. 

Angela would like to take this opportunity to thank her Kiva lenders.
