Agapito se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de fréjol, arveja, habas. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, fertilizantes, insecticidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. 

Las compras las realizará en Ventanas. El sueño es comprar terreno. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades. En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el futbol.
texts.en:
Agapito is 38 years old, married, and has a five year old son.  He lives with his wife and son in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Rios.  He is a member of the Los Amigos community bank, which is located in the Zapotal Nuevo precinct in the canton of Ventanas.  The members work as farmers and fishermen.  

Agapito works as a farmer planting beans, peas, and broad beans.  He is requesting this loan to purchase seeds, urea, fertilizer, and insecticides.  With the loan, he will be able to purchase all the necessary items for farming.  He will make the purchases in Ventanas.

His dream is to purchase land, but he faces challenges such as disease.  In his free time, he likes to play sports, especially soccer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, urea, fertilizer, and insecticides.

loans.name: Salman

texts.en:
Salman works as a master in the field of repair and construction. In addition, he has engaged in farming and cattle. As for his family, his wife is engaged in the sale of dairy products, animals, hay and grain from the yard of their house. Salman wants to build a new and a large barn for his animals, as he plans to expand the agricultural business. 

Salman is 44; he is married and the father of three children ages 8, 11 and 13 years old. He has a spine illness and once a year it requires treatment. His illness creates a problem for him when working. At the moment he has no cash for treatment and so he applied for a loan. This will be the third loan that he has received from VFAC. Previous loans were for the development of his husbandry business. He applied for 1600 AZN to undergo another course of treatment.

loans.use: To cover spine treatment costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, plaguicides, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Tionsso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec NANA KARIA, 2 ème assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 75.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi IV group are married women who are, on average, 38 years old with four children each. They all live in traditional families in Tionsso, one of the villages of the Cercle of Koutiala (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.

They are on their fourth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Nana Karia, a member of the group, is a rice farmer. In the photo, she is in the front row, second from the right.

She plans to use her loan to buy farm inputs, seeds, small tools, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate one hectare (2.47 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she will sell her production to both men and women, in her village and in Koutiala.

She is expecting to make a profit of 75,000 CFA francs at the end of the growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, farm inputs and tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies such as corrugated zinc plates, cement, and more

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Tionsso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec Sanata, 3 ème debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 80.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi III group are married women who are, on average, 48 years old with four children each. They all live in traditional families in Tionsso, one of the villages of the Cercle of Koutiala (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.

They are on their fourth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Sanata, a member of the group, is a rice farmer. In the photo, she is in the standing row, third from the left. 

She plans to use her loan to buy farm inputs, seeds, small tools, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate one hectare (2.47 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she will sell her production to both men and women, in her village and in Koutiala.

She is expecting to make a profit of 80,000 CFA francs at the end of the growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds and tools.

loans.name: Edgar Patricio

texts.es:
Patricio tiene 28 años de edad es casado tiene un hijo, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC LOS AMIGOS, Se encuentra ubicada el Recinto Zapotal Nuevo, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Patricio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, trigo, cebada. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas.

El sueño es comprar un tractor. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan son las plagas y la competencia.
En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el boli.
texts.en:
Patricio is 28 years old, married, and has one son. He lives with his wife and son in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.

Patricio is a member of “Los Amigos” communal bank. He works in agriculture and livestock in the rural area of Zapotal Nuevo.

Patricio works growing corn, wheat and barley. He is requesting a loan to buy insecticides, urea and other fertilizers. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy what he needs for his crops. He will make his purchases in Ventanas.

Patricio’s dream is to buy a tractor. He says that the challenges he faces are pests that harm his crops and competition. In his free time he likes to play sports, especially volleyball.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, urea and other fertilizers.

loans.name: Bolivar Vicente

texts.es:
Bolívar tiene 38 años de edad es casado tiene 4 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC LOS AMIGOS, Se encuentra ubicada el Recinto Zapotal Nuevo, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Bolívar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao. Solicita el crédito para comprar plantas de cacao,  abono. 
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para sembrar el cacao. El sueño es comprar terreno Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el boli.
texts.en:
Bolívar is 38 years old, married, and has four children.  He lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Rios.  He is a member of the Los Amigos community bank, which is located in the Zapotal Nuevo precinct in the canton of Ventanas.  The members of the group are farmers and fishermen.

Bolívar works as a farmer planting cacao.  He is requesting this loan to purchase cacao plants and fertilizer.  With the help of the loan, he will have everything he needs to plant cacao.  

His dream is to purchase land, but he faces challenges such as pests in his crops.  In his free time, he likes to play sports, especially volleyball.

loans.use: to purchase cacao plants and fertilizer.

loans.name: Benkadi V Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi V sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Tionsso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec Chitan Salif, 2 ème debout de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 85.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi V group are married women who are, on average, 37 years old with three children each. They all live in traditional families in Tionsso, one of the villages of the Cercle of Koutiala (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.

They are on their fourth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Chitan Salif, a member of the group, is a rice farmer. In the photo, she is in the standing row, second from the right.

She plans to use her loan to buy farm inputs, seeds, small tools, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate one hectare (2.47 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she will sell her production to both men and women, in her village and in Koutiala.

She is expecting to make a profit of 85,000 CFA francs at the end of the growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and weeding, and to buy farm inputs, seeds and tools.

loans.name: Benkadi Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi VI sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Tionsso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec Korotoumou, 3 ème debout de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 110.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi VI group are married women who are, on average, 38 years old with three children each. They all live in traditional families in Tionsso, one of the villages of the Cercle of Koutiala (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.

They are on their fourth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Korotoumou, a member of the group, is a rice farmer. In the photo, she is in the standing row, third from the right.

She plans to use her loan to buy farm inputs, seeds, small tools, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate one hectare (2.47 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she will sell her production to both men and women, in her village and at the market.

She is expecting to make a profit of 110,000 CFA francs at the end of the growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, farm inputs and tools.

loans.name: Sergio Leonardo

texts.es:
Sergio es un hombre de 29 años, ha aprendido a siempre salir adelante gracias al ejemplo de sus padres, siempre se ha desempeñado en labores comerciales, ya que su carisma le ayuda mucho con las ventas, empezó a trabajar desde muy joven cuando terminó la secundaria, pues en su familia empezaron a presentarse problemas económicos que le impidieron continuar con la universidad y al contrario se vio motivado a aportar con los gastos de su casa. Es un hombre soltero que vive en  Pastaza, un cantón ubicado en la Provincia con el mismo nombre, perteneciente a la Región Amazónica de la República del Ecuador. La cabecera cantonal es la ciudad del Puyo una ciudad ubicada en medio de la selva amazónica al occidente de la provincia de Pastaza y a 924 m. sobre el nivel del mar. Es demográficamente pequeña pero tiene una gran variedad de sitios que son los preferidos para turistas nacionales e internacionales sobre todo los de actividades ecológicas y de deportes extremos. Una ciudad que crece económicamente cada día por las actividades de comercio, ganadería, agricultura y turismo, por lo que en ella se han establecido sucursales de empresas financieras y comerciales que pretenden aprovechar la actividad económica que mantiene esta pequeña ciudad. En cada negocio se encuentra personas que no se han dado por vencidas frente a la falta de empleo sino que han emprendido con sus ideas de negocio para llevar una vida digna y hacer realidad sus sueños.
Sergio luego de adquirir algo de experiencia en el comercio decidió establecer su propio negocio en su ciudad, se trata de la venta de llantas y repuestos de vehículos que lo ejerce desde hace 15 años y lo aprendió gracias a un primo quien le ayudó con los contactos de proveedores y además lo motivó a emprender con esta actividad. Ahora invierte al menos 5 horas en la atención del local, pero se complica y se extiende la jornada laboral cuando tiene que hacer cobranzas con sus clientes, pues no todos pagan de contado y puntualmente. Sin embargo, Sergio ha aprendido herramientas que le ayudan a administrar mejor su negocio, gracias a la asesoría del ejecutivo de Fundación Alternativa en donde ahora solicita un préstamo con el cual comprará variedad de repuestos al por mayor, formando parte de las promociones y mayores descuentos que los proveedores ofrecen a las compras mayores. En anteriores ocasiones, Sergio no pudo obtener el capital por no poseer las altas garantías que le exigían en algunas instituciones, pero gracias a Fundación Alternativa que a través de su producto de Kiva pueden dar una mano a emprendedores microempresarios y de zonas rurales; él podrá hacer realidad su sueño de tener una microempresa y con las ganancias poder retomar sus estudios y prepararse en el área comercial y financiera.
texts.en:
Sergio is 29 years old and has learned to always get ahead thanks to the example of his parents.  He has always worked in commercial jobs since his charisma helps him a lot with sales.  He started to work when he finished secondary school since his family had started to have financial problems that did not allow him to go to university and he wanted to help with the household expenses.  

He is a single man who lives in Pastaza, a canton located in the Pastaza province, which is located in the Amazon region of Ecuador.  The capital of the canton is the city of Puyo, which is a city located in the middle of the Amazon jungle on the western side of the province of Pastaza, and 924 meters above sea level. The city has a small population, but it has a large variety of sites that draw Ecuadorian and international tourists, including ecological activities and extreme sports.  The city grows economically every day from commerce, livestock, agriculture, and tourism activities.  Branches of financial and commercial companies have been established there to take advantage of the economic activity that supports this small city.  In each business, there are people who have not given up on the lack of jobs but have come up with ideas for businesses so that they can live a decent life and realize their dreams.

After Sergio acquired some sales experience, he decided to start his own business in the city.  He sells tires and spare parts for vehicles.  He has done this for 15 years, and learned thanks to a cousin to helped him with the contracts for vendors and motivated him to start this business.  Now, he spends at least five hours at the shop each day, but his day is made longer when he has to make collections from his customers since not everyone pays in cash and on time.  

Sergio has learned tools that help him administer his business better thanks to the advice from Fundacion Alternativa.  Now he is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of spare parts at wholesale.  This will allow him to take advantage of promotions and better discounts that vendors offer for wholesale purchases.  Previously, Sergio was not able to get a loan because he did not have the high guarantees that those institutions request.  Thanks to Fundacion Alternativa through their product with Kiva, they can give a hand to small business owners in rural areas so that Sergio can make his dream of having a small business a reality.  With his earnings, he can go back to school and study business and finance.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts at wholesale.

loans.name: Dúo Solidario El Pilar Group

texts.es:
DUO SOLIDARIO EL PILAR

ANA ES SOLTERA TIENE  21 AÑOS DE EDAD, INICIO SU NEGOCIO HACE TRES AÑOS CUANDO DECIDIO TERMINAR  DE ESTUDIAR  Y TENER UN INGRESO ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ALMUERZOS EN SU DOMICILIO, EN UN PEQUEÑO LUGAR TIENE SU PEQUEÑO COMERDO ELLA DESEA COMPRAR MOBILIARIO Y EQUIPO PARA SU NEGOCIO YA QUE EL QUE EL EQUIPO QUE TIENE NO ES SUFICIENTE. 
ELLA DESEA SEGUIR ESTUDIANDO EN PLAN FIN DE SEMANA Y ASI TERMINAR SU CARRERA A NIVEL MEDIO, ESTA MUY CONTENTA POR QUE SU NEGOCIO ES MUY RENTABLE, PRIMERO ESPERA CRESER MAS EN SU NEGOCIO Y LUEGO CUANDO TENGA LA SUFICIENTE GANANCIAS PONERSE A ESTUDIAR Y ASI CON SU TRABAJO SOSTENER SUS ESTUDIOS ESPERA QUE LE PUEDAN AYUDAR CON EL CREDITO SOLICITADO.
texts.en:
Duo Solidario El Pilar (Supportive Duo Pillar)

Ana is by herself as a 21 year-old. She started her business three years ago when she decided to stop her studies and earn an income. 

She makes a living selling lunches in her home. In a small place, she has a small eatery. She hopes to buy furniture and equipment for her business since what she has is not sufficient. 

She hopes to continue studying on weekends and finish her studies at the middle level. She is very happy because her business is profitable. 

First, she hopes to grow her business more and later, when she has enough earnings, to continue studying. That way her work will sustain her studies. 

She hopes that the loan requested will be able to help her.

loans.use: to buy furniture (tables and chairs) for their business.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María,  requiere de un nuevo  préstamo para invertir en el negocio que desempeña; este le permitirá comprar la materia prima necesaria tales como: tierra de barro, nacazcol, leña, transporte y pago de mano de obra.
El crédito anterior fue de mucha ayuda,  las condiciones económicas han mejorado, ya que lo invirtió en el negocio y apoyo para su familia; el núcleo familiar se mantiene.
texts.en:
Maria needs a new loan to invest in the work she does. This will allow her to buy the necessary raw materials such as: clay, nacazcol (a black dye), wood, transport (freight), and manual labor. 

The previous loan was very helpful. Financial conditions have improved since she invested in the business and support for her family; the family is supporting itself.

loans.use: to pay for clay, nacazcol (a black dye), wood, transport (freight), and manual labor.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is from the town of Getafe, Bohol. She is 27 years old and has two young children. Daisy relies on fishing for an income to provide for her family. She and her husband work hard for their fishing business to flourish. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fish net and gasoline. This will enable her to operate her livelihood on a daily basis to provide for her family. Daisy hopes that someday she can make her livelihood more profitable so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fish net and gasoline

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
This is Mila, 26, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is living with her partner and she is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She and her partner are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Mila maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct-selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are depending on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, Mila is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Mila hopes to have more networks and dreams that her children will have a good education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo is a 59-year-old  married man from Getafe, Bohol. He engages in farming. He grows rice. He has been growing rice for almost 20 years. Danilo requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, pay laborer's fee and have additional capital to sustain his farming business. In the future, Danilo would like to expand his farming business to have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pay laborer's fee and have additional capital

loans.name: Enrique Marino

texts.es:
Marino tiene 42 años de edad es casado, vive con la esposa y con ls hijos en el cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC LOS AMIGOS, Se encuentra ubicada el Recinto Zapotal Nuevo, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Marino se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, trigo, cebada. Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla grueza, insecticidas, urea, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas.

El sueño es comprar un terreno. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan son las plagas y la competencia.
En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el futbol.
texts.en:
Marino is 42 years old and married. He lives with his wife and children in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.

Marino is a member of “Los Amigos” communal bank. He works in agriculture and livestock in the rural area of Zapotal Nuevo.

Marino works growing corn, wheat and barley. He is requesting a loan to buy large seed, insecticides, urea and other fertilizers. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy what he needs for his crops. He will make his purchases in Ventanas.

His dream is to buy a plot of land. He says that the challenges he faces are pests that harm his crops and competition. In his free time he likes to play sports, especially soccer.

loans.use: to buy large seed, insecticides, urea and other fertilizers.

loans.name: Potofou

texts.en:
Potofou is a 22-year-old single woman with one child. She would like to start growing seeds of tomatoes, green and white peppers, etc. to earn a living. Potofou has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, shovels, a water hose, barbed wire, and fertilizer. 

She has been a member of SPBD starting in 2013. Potofou will use her profits to support her family and her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, shovels, a water hose, barbed, wire and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sobia's Group

texts.en:
Sobia is a 32-year-old woman living with her spouse and 2 children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a poor family, as her whole family is fully dependent upon a single earning person and a single source of income as well. Her husband has owned a small general store in a nearby hometown for 12 years.

Her husband is facing a problem with his daily sales and is unable to fulfill the demands of his daily customers due to a shortage of stock. The causes of the shortage of those inventories are that Sobia herself uses all of her household necessities from her husband's general store, and because most of the customers like to buy commodities on a credit basis.
 
Sobia wants to fill the requirements of stock in her husband's general store, and that is why she requested a loan, so that her husband would be able to buy those inventories. Sobia hopes that this loan will bring positive changes to the general store so that she can manage her household expenses through earned income. She is very happy and glad after taking this loan, and she is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Sobia is raising her hand in the picture.

loans.use: To buy flour, pulses (beans), eggs, cooking oil, detergent, soaps, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Nita

texts.en: Nita is 27 years old, married, and has one child. She owns and operates a business venture, tailoring clothes. She has two years of experience in this line of business. Nita needs a loan to buy materials, threads, needles and a new sewing machine. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2007.

loans.use: to buy materials, threads,needles and a new sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Eleitino

texts.en: Eleitino is a 24-year-old married woman with three children. She makes and sells cups and bowls of noodles, as well as snacks, sausage rolls and the like in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience in this business. Eleitino needs a loan to buy an urn, a gas stove, cooking pots and pans, a microwave oven, forks, spoons, foam plates and cups. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Eleitino has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy an urn, a gas stove, cooking pots and pans, a microwave oven, forks, spoons, foam plates and cups.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en: Asma is a 47-year-old Palestinian married woman who has been working in her own business as a tailor for six years, in order to help her husband in making a living. She has gained experience in this field since 1990. He works as a taxi driver with a very low income. Asma used to work as a nurse, but she turned to another business of her own, which is located next to her house. Asma has a very good reputation in her region, with her special talent and the customer service she provides. Her hope was to be a mother, and she is working hard to develop her business, in order to provide her family with a safe and healthy living. She is acquiring a loan to pay for the medications she needs, because she can’t afford to pay them directly from her business income, which barely covers her family’s needs. Asma puts much effort into developing and expanding her business, to make sure that she can remain capable of covering her family’s needs.

loans.use: to pay for medications that she needs.

loans.name: Malama

texts.en: Malama is a 23-year-old divorced woman with two children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Malama needs a loan to buy bag of sugar, a plastic cup and some Chinese lollies (candy). She plans to use her profits to support her family. Malama became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, plastic cups and chinese lollies (candy) for her business.

loans.name: Eglecerio

texts.en:
Eglecerio is 36 years old from Getafe, Bohol. He is married and has five children, ages 6 to 16. 

Eglecerio's main livelihood is through fishing. This business started 10 years ago. Eglecerio is struggling to meet the needs of his family while maintaining his business. 

He is asking for a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy fish net. It will be a great help if he can replace his old ones through this loan. Whatever income he will generate will be for his family's food consumption and the education of his children. 

In the future, he hopes to see his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy fish net.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 42 years old and married. She has five children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. 

Her husband is a fisherman and she helps him to survive by operating their pedicab rental in town. She joined GDMPC in 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to acquire another pedicab unit. In the future, Lorna wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase tires for her pedicab.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 41 years old, married, and has five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Corazon has a food production business in the Philippines. Corazon has been in this business for five years.

Corazon requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Corazon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients fo her food production business.

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
This is Jovy, 22, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is Boni, a construction worker. She and her partner manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for her everyday expenses. Jovy operates a food stall. 

In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families eat home-cooked meals only in the evenings, when all the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to use cooking gas and food for one to two people while when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. 

Jovy’s regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day. To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more ingredients, such as meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products.

Jovy hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a good life. Every week, she goes to meetings with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients, including rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Etelani

texts.en: Etelani is 55 years old, married, and has four children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar and dripping oil. In the future, Etelani hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar and dripping oil to start a business making and selling pancakes.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is a 59-year-old woman who is single and has six children. 

She plans to start a small business, selling chickens. 

Filomena needs a loan to buy barbed wire, water pipe line, cement and a bag of rice for chicken food. She will use her profits to help her children's education. 

Filomena joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, water pipe line, cement and bag of rice for chicken food.

loans.name: Tami

texts.en: Tami is a 29-year-old married mother of two children. She has been working as a hairdresser and a a tutor for four years. Both businesses are located in her house, because she can’t afford to open a beauty salon with the income from her two businesses plus her husband’s low income. That’s why Tami is applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua, in order to open her own separate beauty salon, which will develop her business and increase her income. This separate salon will make her customers more comfortable. Most of her customers are relatives, friends and neighbors. She hopes to keep on developing her business and to open a special larger beauty center in the future.

loans.use: to open her own separate beauty salon, which will develop her business and increase her income.

loans.name: Anina

texts.en: Anina is a 25 years-old single woman with no children. She would like to start growing tomatoes, cabbages and green and white peppers to earn a living. Anina has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a shovel, vegetable seeds, a pickaxe, barbed wire and a water hose. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. Anina will spend her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a shovel, vegetable seeds, a pickaxe, barbed wire and a water hose.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 34-year-old married man, the father of one child. He works repairing cars, specialized in body work and painting. He started this business 17 years ago. Mohamad is well known in his region for his special talent in his field. Mohamad is applying for applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua in order to develop his business. He will prepare a special facility that will make his business easier and faster. This facility is known in Lebanon as an oven, and it covers the car with paint in a professional way. He hopes to keep on developing his business and to attract more customers.

loans.use: to prepare a special oven for painting cars, which will make his business easier and faster.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 57-year-old married man, the father of six children. 

He has been working in selling hot drinks since 24 years ago. He used to work as a fisherman, but his family's increasing needs required a wider business with a better daily income.
 
His business is located in a van, which he parks at the side of the main road of his village. Many customers are loyal to him, and passers by provide him with  additional income.

To make sure that his family members are satisfied, Abdallah has an additional seasonal work: He sells watermelon during the summer season.

Today, Abdallah is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua in order to develop both businesses. He will increase his business merchandise with special hot drink flavors and cups, in addition to increasing his stock of watermelons and selling them with special prices.

Abdallah will work hard to keep on developing his businesses to make sure that his family’s needs are accomplished.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special hot drink flavors and cups and to increase his stock of watermelons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for more stock of liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) to sell in her business.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 73 years old and married with three children. Felomina works very hard to provide for them.

Felomina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell. Felomina has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as soap, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future Felomina would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.en: Fabian is 73 years old, married, and has nine adult children. He lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol, with his wife. Fabian has been engaged in fishing for 25 years. He is also into making clay pots to earn additional income. He is applying for a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy fishing nets and gasoline for his boat. Fabian only hopes that he can continue working and earning, even at his age, so he can look after their needs.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and gasoline for his business.

loans.name: Poeurn's Group

texts.en:
A father, 50 years-old, residing in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Poeurn is married and blessed with five children. Nowadays, only one is still under his responsibility as this child is still in school. To substain the family, he manages one hectare of cassava farming while his wife takes care of the pig-raising business. He has been in current business for 15 years. 

Poeurn has been with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) for past two cycles and has fully repaid back the loan. He has supported his business at a gradual pace to gain more income than before. For the current cycle, he joins a group of two to apply for a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, he is going to buy potash, herbicide, and to pay for weeding fees. He hopes he can support his agribusiness on time and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy potash, herbicide, and to pay for weeding fees.

loans.name: Marisel

texts.en: Marisel, 33 years of age, is married and blessed with two children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost 4 years. In this business she's earning a net income of about Php 300 daily. Due to a lack of capital she's requesting a loan amounting to Php 12,000 to purchase canned goods, breads, biscuits, cooking oil, sugar, coffee and beverages. She's hoping that her business will become more improved and profitable so that her income will increase.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, breads, biscuits, cooking oil, sugar, coffee and beverages.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito works hard to support his family. Juanito is married and has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines.

Juanito requested a 18,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance of his motorcycle.

Juanito has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Juanito would like to save enough money to sustain the financial stability of his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Irene works hard to support her family.

She has a feed retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  Irene is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of feed to sell.

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of feed to sell

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio tiene 34 años de edad, es soltero. Él es muy reconocido en la comunidad como un muchacho responsable y de buenos valores, el cliente se dedica a la venta de mariscos, y artículos de cocina, electrodomésticos, entre otros más de forma ambulante;  actividad que realiza desde hace mas de 20 años, actividad que aprendió de su difunto padre por lo cual él se siente orgulloso de desarrollar esta actividad, además de tener en cuenta que la clientela que mantiene es muy grande porque no solamente abarca el cantón sino que él se desplaza a los cantones aledaños o cercanos al que le reside.  

Los productos los adquiere en la ciudad; por lo que tiene que desplazarse más de 54 kilómetros, distancia que recorre en el transporte colectivo, los productos los compra en los diferentes almacenes de esta ciudad en algunos le dan precios bajos porque compra al mayoreo. Para comprar, los mariscos se tiene que desplazar hasta la playa el cuco que se encuentra a 25 minutos de donde él vive dicha actividad comercial la realiza 2 veces por semana.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más artículos de cocina y mariscos; ya que por la cantidad de clientela que él tiene muchas veces se queda sin producto para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes además quiere reparar parte de la vivienda donde reside; por que se encuentra la parte trasera de esta en un estado de deterioró muy alto al punto que la pared está a punto de caerse y quiere mitigar ese riesgo en su vivienda.

Una de las primeras necesidades en satisfacer es la obtención de ingresos a la familia además de asegurar un mejor bienestar para su familia ya que con la reparación de la pared él podrá omitir en totalidad el riesgo que actualmente corren con la pared en mal estado, además otra de las necesidades a satisfacer son los nuevos productos que podrá ofrecer a sus clientes ya que muchos de ellos le piden artículos que por falta de dinero no puede conseguir. 

Entre sus planes esta, construir una vivienda más segura; ya que actualmente en la que residen está un poco deteriorada por el paso del tiempo, además el sueña con una familia con ingresos estables, con mejores oportunidades de educación, también quiere comprar una pequeña canoa ya que donde el reside se encuentra a unos pocos metros la laguna de OLOMEGA, para poder pescar y poder incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Julio is single and 34 years old. He is well known in the community as a responsible young man with good values. He sells seafood, kitchen items, household appliances, and more as a traveling salesperson. He has been doing this work for more than 20 years, an activity he learned from his late father which is why he is proud to be cultivating this work. In addition, he has a large clientele because he not only covers the canton but travels to surrounding or nearby cantons to where he lives.

He buys his supplies in the city so he has to travel more than 54 kilometers, a distance he makes by public transport, buying products in various stores in the city where some of them give him lower prices for buying in bulk.

To buy the seafood he goes to the beach which by the clock is about 25 minutes away from where he lives, a trip he makes twice a week.

The loan that he is requesting through Fundación Camp is to buy more kitchen items and seafood because he has so many customers that sometimes he does not have the products they need and he also wants to make repairs to his home where he lives. The back part is in such a high state of deterioration that the wall is on the point of collapsing and he wants to mitigate that risk to his home.

One of the first needs to satisfy is to obtain family earnings while ensuring a better quality of life for his family because by repairing the wall he will be able to entirely remove the risk they run with the wall in a bad state. Also, another need to satisfy is buying new products so he can offer his customers what many of them ask for which he can’t get without money. 

In the future he wants to build a more secure home, as currently where they live has somewhat deteriorated over time, he dreams of having stable family income, and better opportunities for education. He also hopes to buy a little canoe as he lives close to the Olomega lagoon, in order to fish and be able to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy more kitchen items and seafood to sell in his business

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 36-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a video games club, where he offers various types of video games for the children of the town. Her husband has been running this business in his hometown for 9 years, and numbers of children come to play video games daily. A few days ago, one of the favorite video games of the children became out of order due to a fluctuation in electricity. 

Shabana belongs to a poor family and has a lot of household expenses, so she cannot save a single penny. Her husband wants to buy a video game, but he is unable to buy it due to a lack of savings. Shabana requested a small loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy a new video game.

Shabana wants to buy a piece of land in her neighborhood town for her children. Her dream is to establish her house, and she wants to see her family in a good position in the society. She is very thankful to Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for giving her this honor in the form of a small loan.

loans.use: To buy a video game for her husband's club.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.en: Alfonso is 36 years old and from the community of Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He is married and has relied on his fishing business for an income for seven years now. He is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fish nets that he can use to replace the old ones. With this, he will be able to improve his fishing business as well as his earnings. The income that he will generate will be used to buy food and further improve his fishing business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is a 56-year-old resident of Sto. Niño, Tukuran. She provides for the needs of her 5 children with the little amount of 8,000 PHP she earns monthly from her fish vending business for 12 years. Her husband goes fishing to catch fresh fish and she will be the one to sell it in town to earn a living. She requests a loan from GDMPC micro credit in order to buy fishing nets. She plans to acquire another fishing boat to be use for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 32 year old from Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has three children ages 1, 12 and 13. Virginia operates a Sari-sari store and raises hogs for a living. This business started five years ago. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed for her hogs. 

With available stock of feed, she can be assured of their healthy growth and a profitable business in four months. Her income is primarily used for family daily consumption and school fees. 

She hopes to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a proud mother of four children and lives in the village of TUkuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband is a private driver and she helps him by earning income with her own bakery. She has been doing this for years. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit in order to buy additional raw ingredients like flour, sugar, butter and vegetable lard. She hopes she will be able to improve her business to have better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients like flour, sugar, butter and vegetable lard

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Loida works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Loida is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance of her motorcycle for her tricycle transportation.

Loida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Warlita works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable selling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Warlita is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Warlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rabbits.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is 41 years old, married and the father of two boys who are 16 and 17 years old. He is engaged in trading.  He has a shop where he sells products for daily consumption and industrial products. He wants to expand this activity and start selling more varieties of goods.

There are practically no bathroom facilities in his house. He needs to build a bathroom, so for this purpose he has applied for a 1,500 AZN loan. He will buy building materials and pay for the labor of the master carpenters. Ismail likes the system of Kiva for people who are in need as he is, so he also decided to participate in the money borrowing.

loans.use: to buy construction material for bathroom building and to pay for labor

loans.name: Angels Group

texts.en:
Farah is the featured borrower of the Angels group.  She got together with her other group members to acquire a YOUTH loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Farah is a 19 year-old single lady who works as a tutor for the past two years, to cover her living and educational expenses. Today she applied for a loan to be used to pay for her university fees. Farah is the one at the left wearing white shirt.

As for the other borrowers, Kholoud is the one wearing light green in the middle, and Nourhan is the one standing at the far right.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees

loans.name: Casimera

texts.en: Casimera is 58 years old and from the town of Talibon, Bohol.  She is married with four children. Her youngest is 17 years old. Casimera has been engaged in fishing and in growing seaweeds for an income for 23 years now. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fishnet and seaweed seedlings so she can continue her business. She is determined to make her business profitable so she can continue to support her family. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and see her children successful.

loans.use: to buy fishnet and seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is from Upper Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 50 years old, married, and has five children. 

Jessie owns and operates a business providing repair services to local community members. 

In 2010, Jessie joined GDMPC. Recently, he requested a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment such as tires, tools and nuts  to improve the business. Jessie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment such as tires, tools and nuts

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan tiene 39 años de edad es soltero  tiene cuatro hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC TIEMPO DE CAMBIO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto la Templanza, pertenece al Cantón Pueblo viejo se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y cacao. Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla gruesa, plantas de cacao, abono.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para la siembra y poder  progresar.
El sueño es progresar y salir adelante y mejorar los productos.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades. En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar todo deporte.
texts.en:
Juan is 39 years old, unmarried, with four children. He lives with his partner and children in the Ventanas Canton in the province of los Ríos. 

He is a member of the communal bank Tiempo de Cambio which is located in the Recito la Templanza, belonging to the Pueblo Viejo Canton where they work in agricultural and livestock pursuits.

Juan works in agriculture growing corn and cocoa. He is asking for a loan in order to buy thick seeding, cocoa plants, and fertilizer.

With the help of the loan he can buy what is needed for planting and to be able to go forward. 

His dream is to progress and move forward improving his crops. The challenges he faces are diseases. In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy thick seeding, cocoa plants, and fertilizer

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en:
Asmat is a 37-year-old woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of 5 children and she is equally responsible for all of them. Her husband owns a welding shop in which he manufactures doors, windows and window panes on demand. He is a professional because he is an experienced welder and has been doing this work for 15 years. 

The people of the town appreciate him for his art, and this is the reason he has a lot of orders for manufacturing. However, he does not have enough raw materials now to fill the orders. Asmat requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 for her husband so that he would be able to buy the needed raw materials. Asmat knows that, with the completion of these orders, the earnings will be increased also, which is beneficial for her family. 

She hopes that this loan will prove to be productive for her husband's business. She is very thankful to Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy iron rods, iron sheets, welding rods and soldering rods for manufacturing doors and windows.

loans.name: Chanphal's Group

texts.en: Chanphal, 29, is married and blessed with two kids. She lives with her family in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She makes a living via rice cropping, which earns her about 26,000 KHR per day. Chanphal and other two borrowers have never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now, they are seeking a joint loan in the amount of 600,000 KHR (200,000 KHR each). As the leader, she will use her loan portion to pay for plowing fees and to buy good fragrant rice for her crop. She hopes that she can double her yield and make a good profit for her agribusiness’s expansion.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and to buy good fragrant rice for her crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Gulnazi

texts.en:
Gulnazi and her family live in the village of Dablatsikhe. She is 58 years old and has a grown son who is a hired worker and gets a small monthly salary.
Nearly 20 years ago, Gulnazi began her own shop, selling food and household items including sweets and candies, dairy products, eggs, canned goods, dishes, etc. 

She considers her business fairly profitable but it needs support for further development. Gulnazi has decided to renew her entire inventory, so she is requesting a loan of 2,100 GEL. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions the provision of a business start-up and re-start-up credits with reasonable conditions for the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. With the amount Gulnazi is asking for, she will buy more merchandise and have a well-stocked store. She will attract more clients and increase the turnover gradually. 

This credit will be a great help for Gulnazi to add more products to her store. She hopes for and awaits Kiva lenders' support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 18 years old, single and has no children. 

She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Juliana needs a loan to buy manure, chemicals, barbed wire, a pick axe, a file for sharpening, and  knife and bush knife. She became a member of SPBD in 2013. Juliana will use the profits from her sales to support her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy manure, chemicals,barbed wire, a pick axe, a file for sharpening, and  a knife and bushknife

loans.name: Benkadi Vii Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi VII sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Tionsso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec  BIBA BOURAMA , 3 ème assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 65.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group called Benkadi VII are married women with an average age of 48 and, on average, three children. They all live in traditional families in Tionsso, one of the villages of Koutiala, third administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, their prior loans having been appropriately reimbursed. 

Rice is the crop cultivated by Biba Bourama, third person sitting from right to left in the photo. With her loan she intends to buy inputs, seeds, small agricultural material and pay for labor to maintain one hectare. Her produce will be sold in the village and in Koutiala, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She expects to make a profit of 65,000 F CFA at the end of the planting season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, farm inputs and agricultural material, and weeding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Naichean's Group

texts.en:
Naichean, a parent in her early 30s, is a citizen from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province and has five children who are still in school.

For the sake of her kids, she grows rice and cassava on one hectare each as the main source of income. She has been involved in her current business since she was 21 years old. The current business has returned her about 21,600 KHR per day.

Naichean is a second-time borrower whereas the other three members are first time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully paid back her past loan wisely and it has supported her business seasonally.

Now, she and her co-borrowers are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, herbicide and to pay for weeding fees as well as transplanting fees. She hopes that she can gain high yield from her business and keep her kids in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide and to pay for weeding fees

loans.name: Thoeurn's Group

texts.en: Theourn is 41 years old and married. She is a resident from Kampong Cham province and blessed with three independent children. To support the daily cost of living, she does rice cropping as their main business while her husband supplements the family income via working for others for a fee. She has engaged in her current business for 23 years, earning about 23,000 KHR per day.  This is the second microloan for Theourn's group, consisting of four female members including her. The past loan, which she has repaid, has enabled her to strengthen her business. Now, the total amount of her group loan is 3,700,000 KHR. For Thoeurn, who is the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can make more income than before to better her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Benkadi Viii Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi VIII sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Tionsso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec Mineta Bala, 1 ère debout de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0.5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 54.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group called Benkadi VIII are married women with an average age of 30 and, on average, three children. They all live in traditional families in Tionsso, one of the villages of Koutiala, third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, their prior loans having been appropriately reimbursed.

Rice is the crop cultivated by Mineta Bala, first person standing from right to left in the photo. With her loan she intends to buy inputs, seeds, small agricultural material and pay for labor to maintain one half hectare. Her produce will be sold in the village and in the market, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to make a profit of 54,000 F CFA at the end of the planting season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, farm inputs, agricultural materials, and weeding fees.

loans.name: Kilisitina

texts.en:
Kilisitina is a 42-year-old woman who is married with 7 children. She runs a business selling sugar, flour, rice, salt and more items in her community. She has 5 years of experience with this business.

Kilisitina has requested a loan to buy a bag of flour, box of milk, sugar, rice, salt, box of herring, laundry powder, soft drinks, spaghetti, mosquito coils, spray and dripping oil. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She has been a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy bag of flour, box of milk, sugar, rice, salt, box of herring, laundry powder, soft drinks, spaghetti, mosquito coils, spray and dripping oil

loans.name: Felixberta

texts.en:
Felixberta is 49 years old and from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has two children ages 14 and 16. She is involved in fishing for an income.  She is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fish nets, gasoline and fish hooks. Felixberta has big dreams for her family and she works hard in order to support their needs. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and see her children successful in their studies.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline and fish hooks

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia, su esposa y su nieto. El, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos  y a la crianza de ganado,  el oficio lo aprendió de sus padres y este lo realiza con mozos, lo desempeña de 5:30am hasta las 2:00pm.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pago de mozos y concentrado para el ganado; esta inversión le ayudara  a desenvolverse mejor, ya que es bastante el cultivo sembrado.
Su sueño es mejorar la propiedad.
texts.en:
José lives with his family, his wife and his grandson. He grows basic grains and raises livestock, work he learned from his parents, and this he does with the help of laborers, working from 5:30AM until 2:00PM.

The loan he is requesting will permit him to buy the necessary agricultural supplies such as: fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and pay the laborers, and buy livestock feed. This investment will help him do a better job considerably improving the harvest. 

His dream is to improve the property.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and to pay laborers, and to buy animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to convert the remainder of his farm to organic coffee production.

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en: Faafetai is a 56-year-old married woman and has six children. She makes and sells cup cakes, pork buns and pies in her community to earn a living. She has 4 years of experience with this business. Faafetai needs a loan to buy sacks of flour, dripping oil, bags of sugar, frying pans, plastic containers, school fees for her children and cement for home improvement. She plans to use her profits to help her children's education and also for her family's daily needs. Faafetai has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, dripping oil, bags of sugar, frying pan, plastic containers, school fees and cement.

loans.name: Mawuha Noblokome Aklakou Group

texts.fr: Le responsable du groupe MAWUHA NOBLOKOME ALKAKOU se prénomme Kouassi. Ce menuisier de 36 ans est marié. Avec sa femme, ils ont trois enfants âgés de 5 à 15 ans tous scolarisés. Il a effectué sa première demande de crédit au sein de notre institution de micro finance(WAGES). Il aimerait diversifier son activité et élargir sa clientèle. Ainsi, il pourrait subvenir  aux besoins de sa famille et améliorer la vie quotidienne de sa conjointe et de sa descendance. En plus de l’artisanat, cet homme cultive du manioc. La quasi-totalité de son groupe est également spécialisé dans l’artisanat et l’agriculture. Ce crédit leur permettra d’améliorer la qualité des produits mais aussi d’élargir leurs gammes de produits et donc leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The leader of the group called MAWUHA NOBLOKOME ALKAKOU goes by the first name of Kouassi. This carpenter of 36 is married. With his wife, he has three children from 5 to 15 years of age, all enrolled in school. He has requested his first loan from the microfinance institution WAGES. He would like to diversify his business and expand his clientele. In this way, he would be able to support his family and improve the daily lives of his spouse and children. 

Besides being an artisan, this gentleman cultivates manioc. Almost all the members of his group are also specialists in arts and crafts and agriculture. This loan will permit them to improve the quality of their products and also to expand the range of products and thus, their clientele.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, wood for carpentry, and products to sell retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereals for farming

loans.name: Chaileat's Group

texts.en: Chaileat, age 36 and a villager from Kampong Cham province, is a mother of three dependent kids. She supports her family via rice farming. The current business, which she has been with for 13 years, earns her about 34,000 KHR per day. Her past loan was the original loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loan already and it has sustained her business better than before. Now, she and her joint borrower are seeking for 500,000 KHR and 1,200,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She highly believes that she can earn a higher income to better support her living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Hon

texts.en: Hon is 54 years old and a citizen from Kror Kor district of Pursat Province.  She has eight children, two of whom are still in school and under her dependency. Currently, she is a rice grower in the local area while her husband makes brown sugar from sugar palm juice. Hon has never been with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) before. She is seeking for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to smooth her farmland in order to be ready for replanting season. She hopes to grow her crops on time and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to smooth her farmland in order to be ready for replanting season

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is married and has four children and all her children go to school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling green bananas and she has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She has been in this business for 10 years selling on a retail basis and works in the market seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring of become a wholesale business and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent, medication and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Ma. Grezil

texts.en:
Ma. Grezil, a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of four children, lives in Militar, Tukuran. She has been operating a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community for years, earning 3,200 PHP a month. 

Having joined GDMPC this year, Ma. Grezil is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional stock of canned goods, milk, and sugar. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of canned goods, milk, and sugar for her general store.

loans.name: Glynn

texts.en:
Glynn is 26 years old, married, with four children. She is from the town of Bien Unido. She is in the fishing business with her husband in order to support her four children ages 1, 3, 5, and 7. 

Glynn needs additional capital so she can continue her business. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy a fish net. She is optimistic about the future and hopes that with hard work she can educate her children with her income.

loans.use: to buy a fish net

loans.name: Salah Al-Din

texts.en:
Salah Al-Din is from Iraq. He is a youth client of 28 years of age, who lives with his parents and his young brother who still continues his education in one of the schools of the city. Salah Al-Din works hard to provide the family income and the tuition fees of his brother all by himself.

Salah Al-Din is a grocer and owns a grocery store where he sells dairy products, snacks, drinks and detergents. He has been running this business since 2006 and through practice, he has gained good experience in this field. Salah Al-Din has a good reputation in the neighborhood.

Salah Al-Din is requesting a youth loan of 2,000 USD. He will use this loan to purchase and install a rolling shutter and an external ceiling for his grocery store. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to take better care of his family.

loans.use: to purchase and install a rolling shutter and an external ceiling for his grocery store

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem is a 23-year-old mother of one and resides in Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. She strives for a living via two hectares of rice farming and a pig-raising business. This business earns her about 39,000 KHR per day. This is the second microloan for Hem with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loan, supports her living and sets aside some money to buy household appliances for her family. For this cycle, she is seeking 1,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer and to pay for gasoline for her hand-tractor. She hopes that she can make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay gasoline for her hand-tractor

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
Ana, vive con sus dos  hijas, los cuales tienen edades de 10 y 15 años, ellas le ayudan a su madre. Ana, se dedica a la elaboración de pupusas y tortillas, dichas actividades las realiza todos los días, las pupusas las elabora por la mañana, mientras que las tortillas por la mediodía.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar una plancha nueva, maíz, frijol, aceite, condimentos,  entre otros, sartenes y laminas; esta inversión le ayudara a fortalecer su negocio y aumentar las ganancias.
Su sueño es obtener mayores ingresos para ayudar a sus hijos a que continúe con sus estudios.
texts.en: Ana lives with her two daughters, who are 10 and 15 years old, and who help their mother.  Ana works making pupusas and tortillas.  She works at this activitiy every day, making pupusas in the morning and tortillas at midday.  The loan that she needs will enable her to buy a new grill, corn, beans, oil, condiments, among other things, and frying pans and baking sheets.  This investment will help her to strengthen her business and to increase her earnings. Her dream is to obtain more income in order to help her children to continue with their education.

loans.use: To buy a new grill, corn, beans, oil, condiments, among other things, and frying pans and baking sheets.

loans.name: Santos Marina

texts.es:
Santos, vive con su esposo  de 60 años de edad, sus hijos de 25 y 26 años de edad, por lo cual todos trabajan para tener una mejor vida. Ella, se dedica a la venta de  frutas, antojitos y siembra de granos básicos,  dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 25 años, en la mañana vende las frutas y por las tardes los antojitos.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar yuca, variedad de frutas y para la agricultura, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a fortalecer su estabilidad económica y a tener mejor su negocio, también satisfacer a los clientes.
Su sueño es construir su casa  en  el lote de tierra que posee para que sus hijos tengan un techo  donde puedan defenderse del agua.
texts.en:
Santos lives with her 60-year-old husband and two children, 25 and 26, for whom everyone works to make a better life.  She earns her living selling fruit and snacks, and growing basic grains.  She says she's been in business for 25 years.  She sells fruit in the morning and snacks in the afternoon.

Santos needs a loan to buy yucca and a variety of fruits, and for her agricultural activities, among other things.  This investment will help her strengthen her economic stability and better her business as well as satisfy her clients.

Santos's dream is to build a house on a plot of land she has so her children can have a roof that keeps the water out.

loans.use: to buy yucca and a variety of fruits, and for her agricultural activities.

loans.name: Benkadi Ix Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi IX sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Tionsso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec Rokia Oumar, 2 ème debout de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0.5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 40.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
