The 10 members of the group called Benkadi IX are married women with an average age of 27 and, on average, three children. They all live in traditional families in Tionsso, one of the villages of Koutiala, third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, their prior loans having been appropriately reimbursed.

Rice is the crop cultivated by Rokia Oumar, second person standing from right to left in the photo. With her loan she intends to buy inputs, seeds, small agricultural material and pay for labor to maintain one half hectare. Her produce will be sold in the village and at the market, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to make a profit of 40,000 F CFA at the end of the planting season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, farm inputs, agricultural materials, and weeding fees.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario vive en la comunidad de Mojopata y tiene 49 años de edad, él se dedica a la agricultura, a la ganadería y a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la agricultura y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizante. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Mario is 49 lives in the community of Mojopata.  He earns his living in agriculture, livestock and raising small animals like guinea pigs.  He's been in agriculture for a number of years and it's going well thanks to his dedication to his work.  He belongs to the "Sol Naciente de Mojopata" [Mojopata Rising Sun] communal bank and needs a loan at this time to buy fertilizer.  He appreciates and values the loan and promises to make his monthly payments responsibly and on time.  (The community of Mojopata is located in a district of Challabamba in Paucartambo Province, Cusco, Perú).

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of tricycles for her transportation business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a single mother of five children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother and sister). She is a tailor and has been in this business for 16 years and has applied for a loan of 1,700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more rolls of cloth material, threads and an electric sewing machine. She works from home six days out of every week and sells retail. She generates additional income  from a pay phone. Her major business challenges are seasonality and defaulters. She aspires of owning a tailoring school and also to educate her children up to university level. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of cloth material, threads and an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida is one of the loyal partners who is being benefited by the loans that she is borrowing. Aside from her repair shop, she also has an electronic loading station and a direct selling business. She only has one child studying in college. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts, supplies and for maintenance of her shop. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and her child's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Bienvenida dreams that her business will stay longer and hopes for a good health for her whole family. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional tools for the repair shop and to pay the salary of the workers

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married Iraqi client, who is 48 years old and the father of 3 children. Ali along with one of his children earn the family income together, while the other two still continue their studies.

Ali is a grocer. In his grocery store, Ali provides all the basic needs of his neighborhood such as dairy products, canned food, snacks, drinks and detergents. Ali established his business in 2007 and has gained his experience in this field through previously working at a grocery as an employee for 5 years. Now he has his own business and has gained an excellent reputation in his neighborhood.

Ali is requesting a loan of 2,500 USD in order to purchase and install an external ceiling for his grocery store and to increase his selling inventory. He is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy and install an external ceiling for his grocery store and to increase his selling inventory

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
El Sr. Celso es una persona muy trabajadora y que lucha por salir adelante, es taxista y cuenta que su anterior de Kiva lo utilizó en el mantenimiento de su taxi. Cuenta además que su esposa tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas y por medio de ambos trabajos estan saliendo adelante.
Celso solicita este nuevo crédito a la fundación y a Kiva para poder ayudar a su esposa y poder comprar insumos para la despensa, como ser bebidas comestibles, carnes y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo y ayudar a su familia. El esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo y poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Celso is a very hardworking person who is fighting to succeed.  He's a taxi driver and says that he used his prior Kiva loan to maintain his taxi.  He also says that his wife has a food stand that she works at every day from early morning and that between their two jobs they are getting ahead.  

Celso is asking for a new Kiva loan so he can help his wife and buy supplies for her stand, like drinks, groceries, meats, etc., so it can keep expanding and help out the family.  He is very grateful for the opportunity he is getting, and that he can continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy drinks, groceries, meat and other items.

loans.name: Siguitemogosson I Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 Femmes du groupe  Siguitemogosson I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Tionsso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec Kadiatou Madou, accroupie en jaune  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 95.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 women belonging to the group called Siguitemogosson I  are married women with an average age of 42 and, on average, four children. They all live in traditional families in Tionsso, one of the villages of Koutiala, third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, their prior loans having been appropriately reimbursed.

Rice is the crop cultivated by Kadiatou Madou, wearing yellow and sitting on her heels in the photo. With her loan she intends to buy inputs, seeds, small agricultural material and pay for labor to maintain one hectare. Her produce will be sold in the village and in Koutiala, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to make a profit of 95,000 F CFA at the end of the planting season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, farm inputs, agricultural materials, and weeding fees.

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya  is married with   six children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (orphans). She has a business of selling fruit and has been in this business for seven years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more baskets of oranges, mangoes and pineapples. She works from home seven days out of every week. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality, transportation, thieves and the perishable nature of her goods. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also building rental rooms. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family, and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of oranges, mangoes and pineapples

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina vive en la comunidad de Mojopata y tiene 29 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Challabamba desde muy temprano y todos los días. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo verduras, carne, arroz, azúcar y otras cosas más. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Marcelina lives in the community of Mojopata and is 29 years old.  She works selling food in one of the markets in the city of Challabamba, starting very early every day.  She has worked at this business for a number of years, and it is doing very well due to the great effort that she puts into her work.  She belongs to the "Sol Naciente de Mojopata" communal bank, and needs a loan now to buy supplies such as vegetables, meat, rice, sugar and other things. She is grateful for and appreciates the loan, and commits to making her monthly payments with great responsibility. (The community of Mojopata is located in the district of Challabamba, in the province of Paucartambo, Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to buy supplies such as vegetables, meat, rice, sugar and other things.

loans.name: Siguitemogosson Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Siguitemogosson III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Tionsso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec Ramata DAOUDA, 3 ème debout de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 75.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of "Siguitemogosson III" are married women averaging 39 years of age and three children each, all living in traditional families in Tionsso, a village in Koutiala (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with Ramata DAOUDA, who is the third person standing from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, seeds, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing to maintain 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in Koutiala to men and women customers. She plans on making a profit of 75,000 francs CFA at the end of the season. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, weeding, seeds, farm inputs, and tools.

loans.name: Siguitemogosson Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Siguitemogosson IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Tionsso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec Djeneba Samba, accroupi avec un panier contenant du riz paddy sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 70.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of "Siguitemogosson IV" are married women averaging 39 years of age and three children each, all living in traditional families in Tionsso, a village in Koutiala (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with Djeneba Samba, who is crouching with a basket [woven from rice stalks] in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, seeds, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing to maintain 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in Koutiala to men and women customers. She plans on making a profit of 70,000 francs CFA at the end of the season. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, weeding, seeds, farm inputs, and tools

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 45-year-old woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has six children ages 9-24. Maria provides for them through fishing. Maria partners with her husband in this livelihood to earn a living for her family. She is requesting for a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy fish hooks, floaters and fish nets. She and her husband work hard for their children. Any income generated will be for food and school fees. 

In the future, she hopes to have other business options and better business profits from fishing.

loans.use: to buy fish hooks, floaters and fish nets

loans.name: Luís Antonio

texts.es:
Luis cuenta con 64 años de vida es soltero y vive juntos a sus padres. Él se encarga de cuidarlos ya que están enfermos. Es muy conocido en la comunidad, desde hace mas de 50 años que se dedica a la agricultura, actividad que realiza con gran destreza, además de ser albañil ya que por fortuna él ha podido desempeñar los dos trabajos de ser albañil tiene ya más de 45 años.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para instalar una pequeña granja de especies menores (gallinas ponedoras y pollo para vender) y para comprar insumos agrícolas para cultivar 21,000 metros cuadrados de maicillo y 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.
 
Una de las primeras necesidades en satisfacer es la obtención de ingresos a la familia además de asegurar un mejor bienestar para su familia ya, que con la colocación de la granja podrá también dar trabajo a sus familiares y estos poder obtener entradas de dinero, además de poder vender la cosecha y poder generar granos para el consumo familiar y para venta de los mismos. 

Sus planes es mantener la granja a tal punto que no solo venda pollos y huevos sino que también poner crianza de cerdos, construir su propia casa y poder heredar a uno de sus sobrinos ya que él no tiene hijos, además de poder brindarse un buen ahorro para un futuro próximo.
texts.en:
Luis is 64 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He is in charge of caring for them as they are sick. He is well known in the community. He has been working in agriculture for more than 50 years, an activity he does with great skill, besides being a mason, and fortunately he was able to do the two jobs being a mason for more than 45 years.

The loan he is asking for from Fundación Campo is to install a little holding enclosure for small livestock (laying chickens and chickens to sell) and to buy agriculture supplies to cultivate 21,000 square meters of sorghum and 14,000 square meters of corn.

One of the first necessities to satisfy is to obtain income to ensure better living conditions for his family, with the investment of the farm he can give work to his relatives so they can earn money, and also sell the harvest and provide grains for household consumption and to sell.

His plan is to maintain the farm to the point where he not only sells chickens and eggs but also to raise pigs, to build his own house and be able to leave an inheritance to one of his nephews as he did not have children, and in addition he wants to save for the near future.

loans.use: to install a little holding enclosure for small livestock (laying chickens and chickens to sell and to buy agricultural supplies to cultivate 21,000 square meters of sorghum and 14,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim is a parent in her early 50s and a married mother of six children. She is a farmer who does rice cropping as the single business to support her daily basic needs. She has been involved in her current business for ages and it has returned her about 4.50 USD per day. This is the first loan for Khim with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

She is seeking this first loan to pay for her son’s tuition, as her son wants to pursue his bachelor's degree, specializing in accounting. She hopes that this loan will support her son’s education cost on time so that her son can pay attention to his studies and get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s tuition

loans.name: Elminaz

texts.en:
Elminaz is 48; she is married but has no children. All her life she has dedicated to work and agricultural engagement. She has a shop right outside her house. There she sells miscellaneous goods like tea, bread, sweets, pasta, and so on.

In addition, she wants to start selling clothing for men, women, and children. She lives in a district where it is difficult to buy clothes. Transport problems are necessarily created, as local residents have to go to the center for clothing. Elminaz asked for a sum of 1,600 AZN. With this money she will buy the necessary things for people to wear.

loans.use: To buy men's, women's & children's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of milk selling with her husband for many years. She has two buffaloes and sells their milk, along with butter and cheese that she makes from their milk to many of her neighbors. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to the main city on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family. She has five children, three of them are in school. She needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to increase their income, Maryam requested for a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She hopes to increase the production capacity of milk which ultimately will help in generating more income.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, marred and has 3 children. Ahmad works hard to provide the income of his family while his wife takes care of their children.

In his shop, Ahmad specializes in selling clothes for women and children. He established his business in 2001 and since then, he has gained much experience in this field and became well-known in the neighborhood with an excellent reputation.

Ahmad is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD, which he will use to purchase additional inventory and to pay the annual rent of his shop. Ahmad's goal is to provide better living standards for his family through expanding his business and increasing his profits.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to pay the annual rent of his shop

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es comerciante, tiene una despensa bien surtida en su casa hace más de 2 años, y también por las noches se dedica a la venta de comestibles. Vive en compañía con el señor Milciades, con quien tienen 2 hijas, viven en un barrio muy cercano al centro de la ciudad de Itá.
Cuenta que surte a vecinos y a ocasionales clientes de todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad para el hogar, tales como azúcar, arroz, lácteos, carbón, yerba, bebidas en general y otros productos, comenta también que ella y su esposo se ayudan y gracias al trabajo de ambos ayudan y dan a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan.
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de una plancha para hamburguesa, ya que a las noches desea realiza la venta de hamburguesas, pancho y asadito ya que por su barrio no existe ese tipo de negocio.
texts.en:
Juana is a merchant. She has had a well stocked storeroom at home for more than 2 years, and sells groceries into the evening. She lives with Milciades, and they have 2 children. They live in a neighborhood very close to the center of the city of Itá.

She says that she sells to neighbors and other customers all types of staple household supplies such as sugar, rice, dairy products, coal, yerba mate drinks, soft drinks in general, and other products. She says that she and her husband support and give the children everything they need thanks to their work.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy a hamburger griddle, as during the evenings she wants to make hamburger sales, hot dogs, and barbecues as this type of business does not exist in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy a griddle to make hamburgers for her home based business

loans.name: Siguitemogosson Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Siguitemogosson II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Tionsso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec Makono, 2 ème debout de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 105.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of "Siguitemogosson II" are married women averaging 41 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional families in Tionsso, a village in Koutiala (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with Makono, who is the second person standing from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, seeds, and sundry equipment inputs and to pay for plowing to maintain: 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in Koutiala. She plans on making a profit of 105,000 francs CFA at the end of the season. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, weeding, seeds, farm inputs, and tools.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 61 años de edad y vive con sus hijos en la ciudad de Challabamba, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, trigo, verduras y otras cosas más. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abonos. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Juana is 61 and lives with her children in the city of Challabamba.  She is an enterprising and hardworking woman who works in agriculture.  She has some plots of land where she grows potatoes, wheat, vegetables, and other crops.  She belongs to the "Sol Naciente de Mojopata" [Mojopata Rising Sun] Communal Bank and currently needs a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.  She appreciates and values her loan and promises to make her payments very responsibly and on time.  (The Mojopata community is located in Challabamba District, Paucartambo Province in Cusco, Perú).

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Cerenisa

texts.en:
Cerenisa is married, with six kids. She is 37 years old and lives in Panduma, Tukuran. 

Cerenisa provides transportation services to earn a living. She's been doing this for more than three years, and every month she earns 2,300 PHP from this work. 

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to pay for tires and seat repairs. In the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for tires and seat repairs

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 33 years old and married, with three children aged 10, 12 and 14. She and her family live in Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for seven years now, earning her an average income of 8,000 PHP per month. 

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies of fresh fish, squid, and shrimp and tools such as a weighing scale and styrofoam. She works hard to support her family and continue to make a business for her children.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy supplies of fresh fish, squid and shrimp, and tools such as a weighing scale and styrofoam

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Rachel successfully paid back her previous loan and is getting a new loan in order to build her general store business.

NWTF is listing Rachel's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large refrigerator, air conditioner and stock

loans.name: Musave Group

texts.fr:
Manassé fait partie du groupe  Musave et habite à  Rumonge. Il  a 45 ans et est marié à  Ndayishimiye, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 11 enfants,  âgés de  6mois  à  23 ans.
  
Il fait le commerce de viande depuis  27  ans. 

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de vaches à abattre pour gagner plus, lors de la vente de la viande.

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait acheter une parcelle et un terrain pour pratiquer l’agriculture. Il voudrait en outre voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Manassé is part of the group Musave and lives in Rumonge. He is 45 years old and married to Ndayishimiye, a farmer. Together they have eleven children, from 6 months old to 23 years old.

Manassé has been doing commerce in meat for 27 years. 

He is on his third Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase many cows to slaughter in order to earn more when the meat is sold.

In the coming years, he would like to purchase a parcel and some land to practice farming. In addition, he would like to see his children go to school.

loans.use: to purchase many cows to slaughter in order to  earn more when the meat is sold

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 51 years old, married, and has 4 children, two of whom are in school. 

Ma. Luz is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Luz requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Ma. Luz has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 21-year-old unmarried woman. She has had a beauty parlor for five years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as make-up, hair styling and facials. Through providing excellent services, she has become famous in her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more varieties of cosmetics products for the beauty parlor.  

Because of having low cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her second loan. She needs a loan of Rs 35,000 to buy packs of cleansers, make-up kits and hair care products. She is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to buy packs of cleansers, make-up kits, and hair care products.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina, age 37, is a married woman. She is a mother of four children; three of them are school-going. Her husband is working on daily wages and earns insufficient income to support a large family. Samina has been stitching clothes for the past seven years to contribute to her family's income. She is very expert in stitching stylish clothes according to fashion. Her regular customers are her neighbors and she makes enough income to meet household expenses. 

In order to expand her business she requested a loan of RKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Rukshana

texts.en: Rukshana, 49, is a married woman who has sold milk for the past six years. She has 2 calves and 3 cows to milk. She milks cows then sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and yogurt that she makes from the milk. She has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk; she maintains a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves to cater to more customers. She hopes to increase her production capacity, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Kammitondé Florence's Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJROMAHUTON est composé de trois personnes, qui résident dans le même quartier. Kammitondé Florence (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo), est la représente de ce groupe. Kammitondé Florence, âgée de 35 ans est mariée à Clément. Le couple à trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Kammitondé Florence vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différents besoins de la famille. Kammitondé Florence n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Kammitondé Florence vend des tissus, du riz et du maïs par la méthode de distribution et à son domicile depuis une dizaine d’années. Kammitondé Florence s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Kammitondé Florence s’associe avec les autres membres de son groupe  pour solliciter un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group DJROMAHUTON is composed of three persons who reside in the same district. Kammitondé Florence (with her hand raised in the photo) is the representative of this group. She is 35 years old and married to Clément. The couple have three children, not all in school but all in their care. Kammitondé Florence lives with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensure that the different family needs are met. 

Kammitondé Florence did not attend school. She has been selling cloth, rice, and corn by the distribution method and at her home for about ten years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering her business, Kammitondé Florence is joining with the other member of her group to request a second ALIDé loan. The previous loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn.

loans.name: Siguitemogosson V Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Siguitemogosson V sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Tionsso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec Setou Salia, 2 ème debout de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Fonfona, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 90.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of "Siguitemogosson V" are married women averaging 34 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional families in Tionsso, a village in Koutiala (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with Setou Salia, who is the second person standing from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, seeds, and sundry equipment inputs and to pay for plowing to maintain 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce will be sold to men and women customers in the village and in Fonfona. She plans on making a profit of 90,000 francs CFA at the end of the season. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, weeding, seeds, farm inputs, and tools.

loans.name: Siguitemogosson Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Siguitemogosson VI sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Tionsso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec Mama Diakalia, 3 ème debout de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of "Siguitemogosson VI" are married women averaging 36 years of age and three children each, all living in traditional families in Tionsso, a village in Koutiala (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with Mama Diakalia, who is the third person standing from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, seeds, and sundry equipment inputs and to pay for plowing to maintain 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce will be sold to men and women customers in the village and in Koutiala. She plans on making a profit of 60,000 francs CFA at the end of the season. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, weeding, seeds, farm inputs, and tools.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is a single mother of five children; four of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. 

She has had a restaurant business for five years; she works from home six days a week and sells on retail basis. 

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, ground nuts, sweet potatoes, rice and chicken.  She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant, and also to build her own house.  

Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas, beef, ground nuts, beef, rice, chicken and sweet potatoes for her restaurant.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
This is Remedios. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. She is also in a rug making business for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Remedios dreams to have a shop for her rug making business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to venture into horticultural farming

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 53-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house for many years.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as she has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health expenses. 

Hassan wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy more stock of rice, sugar and biscuits. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good repayment history. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business further in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and biscuits.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 49-year-old married lady and the mother of six children; she has been sewing clothes for many years. She sews for the people of her community, and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. Therefore, she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.  This will help her increase revenue so she could generate a healthier source of income. 

She is in her second loan cycle, and she is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Grimaneza

texts.es: Grimaneza vive en la comunidad de Mojopata y tiene 32 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida y pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo fideos, verduras, carne, arroz, azúcar y otras cosas más. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Grimaneza lives in the community of Mojopata and is 32 years old. She sells food for a living and belongs to the “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” communal bank. She requires this loan to buy ingredients such as noodles, vegetables, meat, rice, sugar, and other things. 

She is grateful for and appreciates this loan. She is committed to comply with the payment of her monthly installments with much responsibility. (The community of Mojopata is located in the Challabamba disctrict in the province of Paucartambo, Cusco, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as noodles, vegetables, meat, rice, sugar, and other things.

loans.name: Tineere Group

texts.fr:
Mme CLEMENTINE est responsable du groupe TINEERE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de deux (02) enfants. Le plus âgé a 05ans et le moins âgés à 03 ans. Les 02 vont à l’école (la maternelle). 
Mme fait la restauration depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes. 
Elle veut s’acheter 01 sac de riz. 
Elle veut épargner  ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité, mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. CLEMENTINE is the official of the group TINEERE. She is doing well. She is married and the mother of two children. The oldest is 5 years old, and the youngest is 3. The two go to school (nursery school). 

Ms. CLEMENTINE has been in the restaurant business for four years. She gets her supplies from the market in her sector. Her customers include both men and women.

She wants to purchase a sack of rice. She wants to save her profits. Her ambition is to expand her business and to take better care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice for her restaurant.

loans.name: Bao Beoneere Group

texts.fr:
Mr ZAKARIA est la responsable du groupe BAO BEONEERE. Il se porte bien et à même eu un deuxième bébé. Marié, il est père de 02 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 04ans et le moins âgé a 06moins. Il a 03 personnes en charge. 
Mr gère une boutique depuis 02ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 21. Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.
Elle veut s’acheter 10sacs de riz, 03bidons d’huile et 05cartons de spaquetti.
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices. Elle souhaite étendre les limites de son activité et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. ZAKARIA is the official of the group BAO BEONEERE. He is doing well and has even had a second baby. He is married and the father of two. The oldest is 4 years old, and the youngest is 6 months. He has three persons to support.

Mr. ZAKARIA has had a store for two years. He gets his supplies from the Sector 21 market. His customers include both men and women.

He wants to purchase 10 sacks of rice, 3 containers of oil, and 5 boxes of spaghetti. He wants to reinvest his profits. He would like to expand his business and to take better care of his family.

loans.use: to purchase rice oil, and spaghetti to sell

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is a 42-year-old man from the Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 Rwanda Francs (RWF) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.

Innocent started selling lights in December 2012 and has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Alain Serge

texts.en: Alain is a young Cameroonian, aged 28, married with a child and living in an urban area.  He has been in this business for the past two years which makes him  very experienced, stable and successful.  He is likely to succeed because his business is situated in a commercial area in an urban set up, coupled with the fact that he has been in this business for over two years which makes him very experienced.  This loan will increase his stock by 17 percent and his profit by 33 percent and it will go a long way to improve on his standard of living

loans.use: to pay for planks of wood and upholstery

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is a 51-year-old woman from the Kayonza District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking an additional top-up loan of 60,000 Rwandan francs (RWF) to purchase 20 more rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF. 

Eugenie started selling lights in May, 2012, and has sold 70 lights to date, providing clean energy to 350 people. She is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself and her husband.

loans.use: to pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Gbehigbenan 3 Group

texts.fr: GBEHIGBENAN 3 est un groupement de onze personnes, qui résident dans le même quartier. La représente du groupe, nommée Affi Marthe(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 37 ans. Affi Marthe est mariée à Aristide. Le couple a trois enfants,tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Affi Marthe vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges du ménage. C'est pour cette raison que Affi Marthe vend de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs) et d'autres produits divers dans sa région depuis dix ans. Affi Marthe s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Affi Marthe s’associe avec les autres membres de son groupement pour solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
GBEHIGBENAN 3 is a group of eleven persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Affi Marthe (with her hand raised in the photo), is 37 years old and married to Aristide. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. Affi Marthe lives with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensure that the household expenses are covered. For this reason, Affi Marthe has been selling food (rice, polenta) and various other products in the region for ten years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin

With the goal of bolstering her business, Affi Marthe is joining with the other members of the group to request a third ALIDé loan. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase staple foods (rice, corn, etc.)

loans.name: Kirubukene Group

texts.fr:
Catherine fait partie du groupe  Kirubukene et habite à  Gitega. C'est une veuve de 53 ans.  Elle a deux enfants  âgés de 15 à 17 ans, dont 1 étudie. 

Elle fait le commerce de bananes  depuis 30  ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes, à revendre pour gagner plus.

Le gain de son commerce lui permet de satisfaire  les besoins familiaux (achat des habits, de la nourriture,…).
texts.en:
Catherine is a member of the Kirubukene group and she lives in Gitega.  She has two children, aged 15 and 17, one of whom is in school.

She has been selling bananas for the past 30 years.

This is her second loan with Turame.  With this loan, received from Kiva, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas for resale, in order to make more money.

The earnings from her business allow Catherine to meet the needs of her family (purchase of food, clothes...).

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of bananas for resale.

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
Blas es un joven de la ciudad de Concepción, es muy sacrificado ya que estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo, ya que hoy en día es muy difícil poder estudiar si no se tiene los medios necesarios.
Su meta es poder ser un buen profesional,  competente que de un buen servicio a las demás personas. Está estudiando la carrera de análisis de sistemas y tiene como fin ayudar a su familia también.
Este crédito lo solicita para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y de esa forma aligerar su carga y poder seguir estudiando. Esta contento por esta oportunidad que recibe, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Blas is a young man from the city of Concepción.  He is very self-sacrificing because he goes to school and works at the same time.  Nowadays it is very difficult to be able to study if you do not have the necessary means.

His goal is to be able to be a good, competent professional who gives good service to other people.  He is studying systems analysis, and his goal is to help his family as well.

He is requesting the loan to be able to make the university payments.  This will lighten his load, and he will be able to continue studying.  He is happy about this opportunity that he is getting because it will be a big help to him.

loans.use: to make university payments.

loans.name: Moulikatou Abikètou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de six personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Moulikatou Abikètou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo), est la représente de ce groupe. Moulikatou Abikètou âgée de 53 ans, est veuve avec trois enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés et deux à sa charge. Moulikatou Abikètou vit seule avec ses enfants. Moulikatou Abikètou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges et nourrir sa famille, Moulikatou Abikètou mène comme activité la vente de charbons de bois et des condiments à son domicile depuis vingt ans. Moulikatou Abikètou s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Moulikatou Abikètou s’associe aux autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is composed of six persons who reside in the same district. Moulikatou Abikètou (with her hand raised in the photo) is the group's representative. She is 53 years old and a widow with three children, not all in school and two in her care. 

Moulikatou Abikètou lives alone with her children. She did not attend school. To cope with her different expenses and to feed her family, Moulikatou Abikètou has had a business selling charcoal and condiments out of her home for twenty years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering her business, Moulikatou Abikètou is joining with the other members of her group to request an initial ALIDé loan.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with four children and all of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a retail shop and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 25,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap, cooking oil, and bags of bread, maize flour, and rice. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. 

Sarah resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. She works seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges includes seasonality, transportation, and the ever-increasing price of commodities in Uganda. She aspires to selling wholesale only and also to owning a delivery van to ease transportation. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, bags of bread, maize flour, and rice.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 34 años de edad y vive con su familia en la ciudad de Challabamba, ella es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la elaboración de textiles con diferentes tipos de lanas y elabora como por ejemplo chullos, mantas, chalinas y otras cosas más. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo lana de alpaca y oveja. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Victoria is 34-years old and lives with her family in Challabamba.  She is a determined, enterprising and hard-working woman who earns her living making textiles from different types of wool.  She makes, for example woolen hats, blankets, scarves and other items.  She belongs to the communal bank called “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” (Sun born of Mojopata) and needs the loan to purchase work materials like, for example, alpaca and sheep's wool.  Victoria is grateful for and appreciates the loan.  She promises to responsibly comply with her monthly repayment plan.   (The Mojopata community is located in Challabamba District in the Paucartambo Province, Cusco, Perú).

loans.use: to purchase work materials like, for example, alpaca and sheep's wool.

loans.name: San Rafael Alegria Group

texts.es:
El comité San Rafael Alegria tiene 14 miembros, es un grupo nuevo que se formo con la unión de vecinas de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona muy alejada, con escaso acceso a medios de educación y de seguridad. Las integrantes del grupo desean que su ciudad vaya creciendo y mejorando cada vez mas.
La Sra. Maria es una de las integrantes, ella es de una colonia pequeña en distrito de la ciudad de Concepción, donde tiene su pequeño negocio de Venta de frutas y verdura en el mercado municipal y Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona puedan ir mejorando su entorno y así ofrecer una mayor seguridad a sus familias, también poder procurar para ellos un mejor futuro.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de  frutas y de verduras, ya que con ello podrá seguir con sus ventas y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Rafael Alegria" has fourteen members.  It is a new group that was formed by some neighbors from an outlying area of Concepción.  The people there have little access to education and it is not very safe.  The members of the group want their city to keep growing and improving. 
Sra. Maria is one of the members of the communal bank.  She is from a small neighborhood in a Concepción district.  It is there that she has her small business selling fruits and vegetables in the municipal market.  She hopes that, with time and everyone's help, all the people from her area can improve their surroundings and thereby offer improved security to their families and assure them of a better future. 
Sra. Maria is requesting the loan in order to purchase fruits and vegetables.  With them she will be able to keep on with her sales and continue helping her family.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for re-sale.

loans.name: Sayas Group

texts.es:
En su ciclo 11 se encuentra este grupo llamado sayas, donde cada una de ellas esta haciendo su mayor esfuerzo y poniendo todo de si. Ellas estan haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de para poder ir creciendo y mejorar las falencias de cada una e ir mejorando sus vidas y sus ingresos.
Una persona digna de destacar es la Sra. Nancy, quien es muy luchadora, se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos, comenta que es muy sacrificado ya que tiene que estar pendiente de sus animales a toda hora, velar porque no les falte nada. Su sueño es algún día poder completar una pequeña granja con mas animales para criar, y así seguir ayudando a su familia como lo viene haciendo. Solicita esta ayuda para poder comprar cerdos pequeños y también para poder comprar balanceados. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo que el ayudará a seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This is the eleventh loan cycle for the group named "Sayas". Each member is putting in all their efforts and giving everything they have. 

They are completing the self management survey so they can keep growing and improve the shortcomings of each member and improve their lives and income. 

One noteworthy person is Nancy who is a fighter. She breeds and sells pigs. She notes that this is hard work since she has to keep track of the animals at all times and make sure they have everything they need. 

Her dream is to one day be able to own a small farm with more animals to breed and in this way keep helping her family. 

She is requesting this loan to buy piglets and feed. She is grateful for this opportunity since it will help her to grow.

loans.use: To buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Nonnami Floride's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes, qui résident dans le même quartier. La représente du groupe, nommée Nonnami Floride (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 28 ans. Nonnami Floride est marié à Jules. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Nonnami Floride vit avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les charges du ménage. Pour cette raison, Nonnami Floride vend du charbon de bois, du jus de baobab et du bissap à son domicile depuis quatre ans. Nonnami Floride s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Nonnami Floride s’associe avec les autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three persons who reside in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Nonnami Floride (with her hand raised in the photo) is 28 years old and married to Jules. The couple have one child, in school and in their care. Nonnami Floride lives with her husband and child. The couple jointly ensure that the household expenses are covered. For this reason, Nonnami Floridehas has been selling charcoal, as well as drinks made from baobab and from hibiscus flowers, out of her home for four years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

With the goal of bolstering her business, Nonnami Floride is joining with the other members of her group to request an initial ALIDé loan.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Claudina

texts.es:
Claudelina es una joven que trabaja y estudia a la vez, ella esta estudiando la carrera de enfermería, es de la ciudad de San Ignacio. Ella cuenta que lucha por salir adelante y el día de mañana tener un trabajo en un buen puesto de salud y poder ayudar a las demás personas en algo tan importante como es la salud.
Su familia es quien la inspira a poder seguir estudiando y luchando, ya que también quiere ayudarlos y retribuirles todo lo que hicieron por ella.
Claudelina solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad y también para pagar sus clases. Agradece por esta ayuda que esta recibiendo que le permitirá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Claudelina is a young woman who works and studies at the same time. She is studying nursing and is from the city of San Ignacio. 

She says she fights to keep getting ahead so that in the future she can have a good job in the health industry and will be able to help other people with something as important as their health. 

Her family inspires her to keep studying and fighting. She also wants to help them and to recompensate them for everything they have done for her. 

Claudelina is requesting this loan in order to pay for university fees and classes. She appreciates the help she is receiving since it will help her grow.

loans.use: to pay for university fees and classes.

loans.name: Ruth Noymi

texts.es: Noymi tiene 19 años de edad y vive con su familia en la ciudad de Challabamba, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la compra y venta de madera. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Noymi is 19 years old and lives with her family in the city of Challabamba.  She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has a business buying and selling wood.  She is a member of the communal bank “Sol Naciente de Mojopata," and at this time she needs a loan to buy wood.  She appreciates and values this loan, and is committed to making all of her monthly payments in a very responsible way.  (The community of Mojopata is located in the Challabamba district of the province of Paucartambo, in Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to replant his farmland.

loans.name: Libia

texts.es: Libia tiene 41 años de edad y vive con su familia en la ciudad de Challabamba, ella es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de comida pues tiene un pequeño restaurante en su domicilio donde prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, verduras y carnes. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Libia is 41-years old and lives with her family in Challabamba.  She is a determined, enterprising and hard-working woman who makes her living selling meals in a small restaurant located in her home.  She prepares food for breakfast, lunch and dinner.  Libia belongs to the communal bank called “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” (Sun born of Mojopata).  At this time, she needs the loan to purchase supplies like, for example, rice, sugar, noodles, vegetables and meats.  She is grateful for and appreciates the loan.  Libia promises to responsibly comply with the monthly repayment plan.  (The Mojopata community is located in the Challabamba District of Paucartambo Province, Cusco, Perú).

loans.use: to purchase supplies like, for example, rice, sugar, noodles, vegetables and meats.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto vive en la ciudad de Challabamba, tiene 43 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre, él se dedica a la agricultura y tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra diferentes productos como por ejemplo papa, trigo, cebada y maíz. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la agricultura y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para pagar los salarios de los trabajadores quienes trabajan en el terreno de cultivo. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La ciudad de Challabamba está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Luis Alberto lives in the city of Challabamba.  He is 43 years old, and is in a common-law marriage.  He is a farmer who has a number of plots under cultivation where he is growing a variety of products such as potatoes, wheat, barley and corn.  He's been a farmer for a number of years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  He is a member of the communal bank “Sol Naciente de Mojopata," and at this time he needs a loan to pay the wages of workers who he hires to work on his land.  He appreciates and values this loan, and is committed to making all of his monthly payments in a very responsible way. (The city of Challabamba is located in the Challabamba district of the province of Paucartambo, in Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to pay the wages of workers who work in his fields

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
Yenny es una joven que el día de mañana quiere ser una profesional que pueda ayudar a las demás personas y también a su comunidad.
Quienes siempre han estado a su lado apoyándola en todo es su familia, y quiere poder ayudarles también así como ellos hicieron. Comenta que está estudiando la carrera de enfermería y al culminar y con su trabajo quiere poder llegar a ser jefa de enfermería.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de cuotas de la universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y luchando.
texts.en:
Yenny is a young woman who in the future wants to have a job where she helps other people as well as her community. 

Her family has always been at her side supporting her and she wants to be able to take care of them as they have done for her. She says she has been studying nursing. Eventually she wants to become a head nurse. 

She is requesting this loan to pay for university fees. This way she can keep studying and fighting.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La Señora Maria continua dedicandose a la venta de comestibles ,la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia  a su negocio ,la socia es una persona responsable,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de aceite y arroz para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the "Clorinda Matto de Turner" communal bank, which is part of the Arariwa Association.

Maria is still working in cosmetics sales, which she has done for years. The business is going well thanks to the effort she puts in every day. She is a responsible person. She wants to keep working so she can continue to support her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy cooking oil and rice for her business. Maria is grateful for the loan provided and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and rice for her business

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es una joven muy estudiosa, cuenta que dentro de unos años se ve al mando de su propia empresa, lo cual podrá hacer gracias a los estudios que está siguiendo.
Su carrera es la de administración de empresas, y cuenta que le gusta mucho, es una estudiante dedicada y abocada a terminar sus estudios y ser una profesional excelente.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases de la universidad. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda y con lo que podrá seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Sonia is a studious young woman. She says that in a few years she will have her own business thanks to her studies. 

She is studying business administration. She likes it very much. She is a dedicated student who is committed to finishing her studies and become an excellent professional. 

Today she is requesting a loan to pay for her university classes. 

She is grateful for this opportunity because it will allow her to keep studying.

loans.use: to pay for university classes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fertilizers and re-sow a part of her coffee farm.

loans.name: Lissi

texts.es:
Lissi es de la ciudad de Ybycui, cuenta es que es hija de padres separados, que ha tenido que luchar mucho para estudiar y el día de mañana ser una profesional. Poco a poco y por medio de la ayuda de su madre ha ido creciendo.
Tiene muchas metas pero por la principal que lucha es poder ser una profesional útil que sirva no solo a su familia sino también a su comunidad.  Ella está estudiando la carrera de nutrición, y solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en los gastos de titulación de la universidad, ya que las gestiones son muy caras y está necesitando.
texts.en:
Lissi is from the city of Ybycui.

Her parents are separated and she has had to fight hard to study so that  in the future she can be a professional. 

Little by little thanks to the help of her mother she has kept moving forward. 

She has many goals but the main one is to keep fighting to become a useful professional who not only helps her family but also her community. 

She is studying nutrition and is requesting a loan to pay for the university degree fee since the administration costs are very expensive but necessary.

loans.use: to pay for the university degree fee.

loans.name: Abrahn

texts.es:
El socio Abrahan se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el socio realiza transporte urbano en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Calca,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es tener un carro.El socio solicita el credito para comprar repuestos para su mototaxi.

El socio esta contento con el credito ys e compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Abrahn is still working in the transportation business. He works in urban transportation on the different streets of Calca. He works from 8:00am until 6:00pm. Abrahn has had this business for six years and it is going very well. His dream is to have a car. He is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for his motor taxi.

Abrahn is happy with the loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his motor taxi

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 56 years old and married; she has one child who stays with her in Tukuran, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail shop in the local community to earn a living. She has been in business for years, and earns 7,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she had requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase rice and feeds to sell. 

In the future, Estrella wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice and feeds to sell.

loans.name: Maria Agnes

texts.en:
Maria Agnes is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and the mother of two children.  She operates a general store selling goods in the community to earn a living. She has been doing this business for many years, and she needs to add stock to diversify. 

She wants a loan from GDMPC to buy rice, feeds and corn grits to sell. 

She planned to renovate her store to make business comfortably and gain more costumers.

loans.use: to buy rice, feeds and corn grits

loans.name: Yrami Ines

texts.es:
La socia Yrami se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,galletas y aceite.

La socia esta contenta con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de sus cuota.
texts.en:
Yrami continues with her business of selling basic needs products like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.  She has a grocery store where she sells from 8:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m.  She has had this business for six years, and it is going very well for her.

Her dream is to expand her grocery store business.  She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, cookies, and cooking oil.  She is happy with the loan that was granted, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cookies, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Milagro

texts.es:
Milagro tiene 58 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene tres hijos; pero solo vive con dos de ellos. Durante tota su vida, ella se ha dedicado a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa. 

Ella es una mujer muy luchadora; se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana todos los días para dirigirse a su trabajo, que consiste en cuidar una casa, para llegar a su destino camina media hora el la mañana y media hora en la tarde luego viene a realizar los oficios de la casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para reparar su casa; debido a que esta en mal estado y desea  arreglarla ya que en la época lluviosa todo se moja al igual que las paredes se debilitan por lo que quiere comprar tejas para reforzar el techo y cemento para reforzar las paredes.

Reparando su casa, ya no tendrá que preocuparse por que las camas se le mojan o porque se le mete el agua por las paredes, ella podrá dormir tranquila al igual que cuando este trabajando no estar pensando que pueda  pasar  en su casa cuando este lloviendo.

Su objetivo es,  seguir trabajando y poco a poco seguir reparando su casa hasta dejarla en muy buenas condiciones para que sus hijos puedan estar muy cómodos en  ella.
texts.en:
Milagro, 58 years old, is divorced and has three children. However, she only lives with two of them. All her life, she has worked in the home, taking care of domestic tasks.

She is a hard-working woman. She gets up at 4:00am every day to begin her work, which consists of taking care of one house. To get to her destination, she walks half an hour in the morning and half an hour in the afternoon. Then she comes to complete the housework.

The loan she is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to repair her house because it is in bad shape and she wants to fix it up. In the rainy season, everything gets wet. The walls are also weak so she wants to buy tiles to strengthen the ceiling and cement for the walls.

By repairing her house, she will no longer have to worry that the beds will get wet or that water will get into the walls. She will be able to sleep in peace. Also while she's working, she won't worry or think about what is happening at home every time it rains.

Her goal is to keep working and continue repairing the house little by little until it is in good condition so her children feel comfortable there.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La socia Silvia pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” y este banco está situado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia Silvia continua con su negocio de venta de jugos, la socia prepara distintas combinaciones de jugos para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gr4acias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir poyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de fruta como platanos, papayas entre otros.

La socia Silvia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Silvia belongs to the “Clorinda Matto de Turner” communal bank.  This bank is located in the Calca district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.  Silvia continues with her business of selling juices.  She prepares different combinations of juices for her customers that request them.  She has been in her business for some time, and it is going well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.

She wishes to be able to continue working and, in this way, continue supporting her family.  She is requesting the loan to buy fruit like bananas and papayas, among others.  Silvia appreciates and values the loan that has been provided.   She pledges to make her payments according to the established timeline.
