loans.use: to buy fruit like bananas and papayas, among others

loans.name: Kantutas Blancas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTAS BLANCAS”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda comercial, venta de leche, librería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; cuenta que este negocio lo heredo de sus padres hace varios años, ya que es un negocio familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de vaca) que adquirirá de las comunidades aledañas y posteriormente a la crianza, comercializará la leche en su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The Kantutas Blancas community bank is starting their fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada regional center.  The group is made up of eight members and directed by a board where Rosa is the president.  The members' businesses are varied and include commercial stores, milk sales, and a bookstore.

Loans like this benefit small business owners like Rosa.  She says that she has done four loan cycles with Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a promoter of the institution that came to visit her at home.  Currently she has a business selling milk.  She inherited this business from her parents many years ago since it is a family business.

She is requesting this loan now for working capital to purchase a cow.  She will acquire it in neighboring towns and later raise it and sell the milk in her community.  The type of work allows her to generate income to support her household since she lives in a common-law marriage and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Jose Cristobal

texts.es:
José, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en su actividad que desempeña; este le servirá para comprar vacas paridas de repasto.
El efecto del crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar sus ingresos y seguir trabajando en su negocio; las condiciones económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en:
José has chosen to request a new loan because he needs more operating capital so that he can continue investing in his business. This will enable him to buy two nursing cows for grazing.

The effect of his previous loan helped him to improve his income and continue working in his business. Both his financial condition and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy two nursing cows for grazing.

loans.name: Fiza

texts.en:
At the age of 30, Fiza is an energetic married lady. She lives with her husband and three children. Her husband is employed in a small factory, and his income is insufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. 

Fiza has been in the business of sewing for many years; she started her business to contribute to the family income. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques, and has retained regular customers. Due to increasing demands of her customers, she needs to buy a stock of thread with some packs of buttons, ribbons, laces and zippers in various colors. 

She has requested a loan of Rs 15,000 to complete the orders of her customers on time. 

She hopes to grow her business, and dreams of providing a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread with some packs of buttons, ribbons, laces and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Vicuñitas De Mercedes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VICUÑITAS DE MERCEDES”  iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Martha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: trenzado de mantas, venta de camas, venta de mantas, venta de chompas, venta de chicharron, venta de mantas de vicuña, venta de fruta, venta de tenis.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Martha es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió hace veinte años atrás al prender la técnica de tejido.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las empresas de la Ciudad de El Alto por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones, el crédito y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The community association "Mercedes' little vicuñas" will initiate its seventh cycle with the organization Pro Mujer, as part of the Waterfall Focal Point project. The group is composed of 9 members and is led by a board of directors, with Martha serving as the president. The businesses belonging to the members of the community association are diverse and among them there are: braiding rugs, the sale of beds, the sale of rugs, the sale of sweaters, the sale of sausage, the sale of vicuña wool rugs, the sale of fruit, and the sale of tennis shoes. 

The requested loan will benefit these small microenterprises, including Martha's, who is a member. She told us that she joined Pro Mujer 5 years ago after being invited by a friend who is a member of the institution. Today she has a business selling rugs. She told us that she started this business over 20 years ago when she learned the skill of weaving.

The loan she is seeking today will be used to increase her capital (by buying  wool) through acquisitions from businesses primarily in the city of El Alto and later through the creation and sale of items for her salesroom. This type of work allows her to generate earnings to maintain her home as much as possible. In addition, she is married and has three children.
 
When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer she responded that she likes the trainings, the loans, and the health services.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es: La Sra. Maria sigue con la actividad de la venta de cosméticos y joyas, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de cosméticos por mayor que se encuentra en promoción, cuenta que le fue bien  creció en su actividad e incremento su clientela, y por ende sus ingresos económicos, en esta ocasión solicito el crédito para la compra de cosméticos por mayor para seguir incrementando su capital de trabajo, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Maria still sells cosmetics and jewellery. Her previous loan worked out very well as she was able to buy low cost cosmetics wholesale. As a result, she gained customers and increased sales, and thus, also her net income. 

This time she is requesting a loan to buy wholesale cosmetic products to continue increasing business profit. She is happy and grateful for the new opportunity this loan will provide.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics wholesale.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three children, the youngest of whom is 18 years old. She works in retail. She has a sari-sari store business, where she sells items like biscuits, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, soaps, and seasonings. In addition, she has also had a fishing business for 30 years. She is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy gasoline, fish hooks, and a fishing net.

She hopes to expand her business and improve her profitability, so that she can better support her family in terms of food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, fish hooks and a fishing net.

loans.name: Mariano Mercedes

texts.es: Mariano vive en la comunidad de Mojopata y tiene 33 años de edad, él se dedica a la construcción de casas y en sus horas libres se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar alimento para cuyes como pasto. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Mariano, age 33, lives in the community of Mojopata. He builds houses for a living and, in his spare time, raises small animals such as guinea pigs. Mariano has been raising small animals for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort he puts forth in his work. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” (Rising Sun of Mojopata).

Mariano is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that he can buy feed, such as fodder, for his guinea pigs. He is appreciative of and values this loan, so he promises to complete his monthly payments with a great deal of responsibility.

The community of Mojopata is located in the District of Challabamba in Paucartambo Province, Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy feed for his guinea pigs.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 17 y 25 años. Ella, se dedica  a la venta de antojitos, oficio que lo realiza junto con su familia para salir adelante y lo desempeña todos los días, asimismo sale a vender a las diferentes colonias aledañas al municipio.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar yuca, papas, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a tener mejores ingresos y fortalecer su negocio.
Su sueño es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y asimismo construir su casa en un lote de terreno que posee.
texts.en:
Marta lives with her husband and their children, who are ages 17 and 25. She sells snacks and engages in this trade with her family so that they can get ahead. Marta works at her business every day and also sells in the different neighborhoods surrounding her town.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cassava, potatoes, and other supplies. This investment will help her to generate more income and strengthen her business. Her dream is to provide a better quality of life for her family and to also build a house on a plot of land that she owns.

loans.use: to buy cassava, potatoes, and other supplies.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 56-year-old married woman. She has successfully been running a small general store in the corner of her house, and she has two years of experience in this field. Her husband assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, as she has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Zubaida is the mother of four children, and she is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packages of salt, biscuits, and beverages, in order to meet the growing demand from her customers. 

Zubaida is in her third loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 43 years old, married and has seven children. She used her last loan to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. Her husband is the one to go fishing and she will be the one to sell it in town for a living. Her business has grown up and become successful. Now, she's taking a new loan to buy fishing nets. Positively, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is married with four children, and all of her children go to school. She has a business selling charcoal. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She has been in this business for nine years. She doesn't have any other income-generating activities, and she works from home seven days a week.

Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season, which hinder her movements. She aspires to buy a delivery van to ease transportation, and also to buy land and build rental rooms. She resides in her family home and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Zenelia Del Carmen

texts.es: Zenelia tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera estudiante de la carrera de contaduría pública y finanzas, está trabajando como auxiliar contable en una empresa privada, con su salario se ayuda para los gastos de universidad, pero no le es suficiente como para pagar el curso de titulación, lo cual ya se acerca para finalizar su carrera. Para este fin  solicita el crédito para pagar este curso tan importante para el futuro de Zenelia, ya que con titulo en mano podrá tener la oportunidad de devengar un salario digno y justo.
texts.en:
Zenelia is 31 years old and single. She is studying for a degree in Public Accounting and Finance. Zenelia works as an assistant bookkeeper at a private business. Her salary helps with her university expenses, but it is not enough to pay for a course that is required for her degree, which she is close to completing. Therefore, Zenelia is requesting a loan to pay for this course since it is very important for her future.

With a degree in hand, she will have the opportunity to earn a decent and fair salary.

loans.use: to pay for a required course for her degree.

loans.name: Mercilinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Mercilinda works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns income from farming sugarcane and rice graining. Mercilinda is borrowing PHP 40000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Mercilinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 41 years old and married.

Alejandra works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like shampoo, sugar, eggs, noodles, snack foods, canned goods, etc. in her general store.

Alejandra has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years. She also earns additional income from buying and selling medicines and raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Alejandra aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell like shampoo, sugar, eggs, noodles, snack foods, canned goods, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Roque Iván

texts.es:
Roque es un hombre de 39 años de edad, esta acompañado y ha procreado dos hijos. Durante toda su vida se ha dedicado a desempeñarse como agricultor; de lo cual posee mucha experiencia fue un trabajo que aprendió de sus padres él antes estudiaba, vive junto a su compañera de vida e hijos.

Todos los insumos son comprados en una ciudad que esta a unos 15 kilómetros de su casa; pero también compra bovinos que es su fuerte, y es la actividad que más esfuerzo le demanda para adquirirlos; lo que significa que él se traslada hasta donde esta un ganado barato y bonito sea donde sea por lo que invierte bastante tiempo y dinero.
.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar de cuatro a cinco bovinos ya que tiene unos terrenos con mucho pasto y lo aprovechara para engordar los animales y en un futuro obtener ganancias con la venta de ellos. Con la compra de los bovinos podrá alimentarlos con el pasto de sus terrenos, ya que se están desperdiciando. También, podrá disponer de activos que en cualquier momento de apuro que pueda pasar echar mano de ellos y así no pasar por ningún problema grave.

Desea, seguir trabajando con la compra y venta de bovinos para que de alguna manera le generen ingresos para su familia y poder darles lo mejor con las ganancias.
texts.en:
Roque is 39 years old. He has a partner and two children. He has worked as a farmer throughout his life, and is therefore highly experienced. He learnt the trade from his father before he started his studies. He lives together with his life partner and children. 

All supplies are bought in the city which is situated 15 kilometres from his house. Although, he also buys and sells cows, which he considers his forte. They are also the most difficult to acquire: he has to travel to where good quality cattle can be bought cheaply, which often requires a large investment of his time and money. 

The loan he is requesting through Fundación Campo will buy four or five cows, as the land he owns currently has a rich pasture and he wishes to make the best of his fields to fatten his animals so in the future he can earn money selling them. By buying cows now, he can feed them on his rich pastures before they begin to spoil. He will also have spare credit, to avoid disaster should such an occasion arise.

He wishes to continue buying and selling cows in order to maintain his family and provide the best for them with the income earned.

loans.use: to buy four or five cows

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, a married mother blessed with four children, owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Marian cooks food for sale at the market, selling to town dwellers and passersby. She cites food leftovers leading to losses as her major business challenge. She dreams of establishing a café in the future.

With this Kshs 15,000 loan she will purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en: Saeeda, age 45, is in the business of animal sales to support her family. She buys animals (baby goats) at low prices, brings them up, then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to meet the demands of her two children. For the improvement of her business she requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to purchase two more goats. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is a single mother of four children, two of whom go to school. She doesn't take care of any additional family members. She has business selling green bananas and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She doesn't have any other income generating activity. 

Her major business challenge includes seasonality and transportation of bunches of green bananas from the villages to her stall at the market. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells at the market on wholesale only. She is aspiring of owning a delivery van to ease in transportation and also to get enough profits so as to build rental rooms. 

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, medication and paying for electricity.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Maredith

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Maredith works hard to support her family. She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for it.

Maredith has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Three years ago Naseem, a 36-year-old married woman, started her general store business at the corner of her house. Her husband assists her by purchasing stock from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. This mother of two is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

Naseem wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy packs of grains, rice and flour to meet increasing customer demand. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of grains, rice and flour.

loans.name: Alaga

texts.en: Alaga is a 49-year-old married woman with 4 children. She would like to start growing peanuts to earn a living. Alaga has requested a loan to buy pick axes, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a bush knife, fertilizer and a sack of unripe peanuts. She became a member of SPBD in 2013. Alaga will spend her profits to help with her family's daily needs and also for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy pick axes, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a bush knife, fertilizer and a sack of unripe peanuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compact discs and also lotions for women and men.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia has expertise in hand embroidery and is using her skill to provide for her family for over 7 years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business she barely made enough money to purchase the required materials. Today she is proud to be famous in her community to be the best at making beautiful patterns with threads and beads.

Now she requested a loan worth 25,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to purchase more frames, needles, threads with some packs of pearls and stones in various colors to increase her sales. She is on her third loan with a good loan history. She wishes to maximize her profits from this business and is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to purchase more frames, needles, and threads with some packs of pearls and stones in various colors.

loans.name: Nayruth Noeli

texts.es:
La socia Nayruth se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de frutas,la socia vende manzanas,naranjas,platanos entre otras frutas,la socia vende a los diferentes lugares donde venden fruta,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar manzanas,naranjas y platanos.

La socia esta contenta con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Nayruth continues working on her business purchasing and selling fruits. She sells apples, oranges and bananas, among other fruits. She sells her fruits in several different locations. She works from 8:00am to 5:00pm each day.  Nayruth has worked on this business for 6 years and it is going very well. She dreams of owning a location where she can sell her fruits. She is seeking this loan to purchase apples, oranges and bananas.  She is content with the loans and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy apples, oranges and bananas.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita, who is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, is married and has four children. To make a living, Conchita has been running a general store for years, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community.

In 2008, Conchita joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase dried fish and bagoong. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish and bagoong

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 71 years old and married with twelve children. She works very hard to provide for them. Francisca runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 19,500 PHP through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, soap, canned goods and milk to sell. Francisca has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Francisca would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, soap, canned goods and milk to sell.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 33-year-old married woman who lives near Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three school-going children. Shabana's family is poor and their living standard is inadequate.

Her husband owns a welding shop and it provides his only source of income. Her husband has to work very hard to feed his family.  Recently, the welding plant was shut down because of broken machinery and her husband has been unable to work and earn money.

Shabana humbly requests a loan of RS 45,000 from BRAC Pakistan. This will allow her husband to buy new welding tools and reopen his business. Shabana wants to establish a decent standard of living for her family. She will save some of the profit to meet such expenses in the future.

Shabana is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy welding tools

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La socia Asunta se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de maiz,la socia lo vende en los diferentes mercados,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender el maiz.La socia solicita el credito para comprar maiz.

La socia esta contenta con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Asunta continues working on her business buying and selling corn. She sells corn in many different markets. She works from 8am to 6pm. She has worked on this business for 5 years and it is going very well. She dreams of having a place where she can sell her corn. She is seeking this loan to buy corn. She is content with the loans and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Fortaleza 5K Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FORTALEZA 5K”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de dulces, tejido de mantas, tienda de barrio, venta de papa, venta de ovejas, venta de jugo de quinua.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de chompas y mantas; cuenta que este negocio lo realiza hace tres años al aprender las técnicas de tejido.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Fortaleza 5k" (Strength 5K) will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascada regional center. It consists of eight members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Rosa is the President. The businesses of the members of the bank are varied. Among them are selling sweets, weaving blankets, neighborhood store, selling potatoes, selling sheep, and selling quinoa juice.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these little micro-entrepreneurs, of which Señora Rosa is one. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer two cycles ago, joining at the invitation of a recruiter from the institution who came to visit her in her home. Now she has a weaving business and sells sweaters and blankets. She relates that she has had this business for three years after learning weaving techniques.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital (by buying wool), which she will acquire from the fairs in the city of El Alto, and after making things she will sell them at the fairs. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as best she can, since she is married and has four children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings plan.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth manages her own store selling groceries in the village of Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is the proud mother of two and her husband is a fisherman. Fishing is their main source of income. She helps her husband by running the store for a living. In order to purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar and sachet products, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit which she joined in 2008. She hopes to improve their living conditions someday.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar and sachet products.
